interdicted fulmined againſt emperour fredericke conuinced ſuch crime pope obiected againſt therefore purpoſe hee depoſed empire left seigneury ſpoile pillage firſt ſhould attempt inuade crime whereof accuſed emperor ſo execrable deſerue depoſing empire depoſition ought bee done generall councell onely pope capitall enemie iudge partie cauſe owne part quoth vntill thenthe emperor good ſeruice holy land acknowledge ſaid fredericke innocent honeſt good neighbour neuer knew thing ſauoured hereſie catholique faith perfidious dealing towards men well know hath fought valiantly law ieſus chriſt well firme land againſt heretiques beyond sea againſt sarazen dreadleſſe perills hazard warre haue found zeale ſo feruent deuout pope man ought aduance ſeruice god loue protect defend ſaid fredericke againſt enemy whereas quite contrary endeuoured power ſupplant depriue empire time abſence cunning trickes vnreaſonable way part meaning hurle ſelfe headlong ſuch quagmire declaring war againſt fredericke ſo potent hath haue need aſſiſtance king prince neighbour friend cauſe ſo iuſt would pleaſure contentment vnto romanes ſee riuers streames prodigally ſluced forth bloud ſatiate glut rage fury owne meanes others could trample vnder foot king potentate world tranſported audacions proud gale winde ſo great emperor fredericke ſhall ſee himſelfe trode downe without hope meanes riſing againe neuertheleſſe ſeeme appeare diſdainingan article inueterate malice whereof prince need ſenſible miſpriſing pope meſſage though plainely euident done rather hatred emperour fredericke fauour romane church beareth v part ſend ſaid emperour fredericke diſcreet well aduiſed ambaſſadors vnderſtand credence catholique faith end may certaine duly informed therein • f nothing found may ſubiect reprehenſion ſhould wee make warre vpon finde contrary marche open field onely againſt euen againſt pope himſelfe hee offenſiue god • ea againſt perſon liuing valiantly purſue proſecute euen death pope nuncio returned magnanimous generous anſwerethe return pope nuncio rome ambaſſadors ſent emperor fredericke quite contrary pope expected king owne behalfe ſent ambaſſadors emperor fredericke acquaint pope good • letter ſaid emperour read amazed calumny thus impoſed made anſwer ambaſſadors france catholique chriſtian conſtantly beleeued article orthodoxall faith god forbid quoth ſhould euer forſake beleefe moſt famous grandfather walke way wickedthe emperor word ambaſſadors call god • udge betweene pope hath ſo wickedly ſcandalized mee world ſelfe lifting hand towards heauen eye ſtreaming forth teares voyce confounded heartbreaking ſighes grones cried god thou god vengeance reward pope according deſeruings turning ambaſſadors ſaid moſt deare friendsthe pope moſt maliciouſly addicted emperour good neighbour beleeue vndoubtedly whatſoeuer vtter enemy bloud • aith would depriue mee honor beleeue chriſtian ought beleeue diſpoſed make warre vpon credit conſtantly wil defend ſelf valiantly againſt preſume meddle hope firmly grounded god protector ſhield innocent • hat deliuer enemy god knoweththe pope ioyned emperours enemy pope fauouring rebellious ſubiects millaine heretiques hath thus bandied himſelfe againſt obliged render infinite thankes king ba • ons france would vnderſtand take knowledge manner man gaue credit pope perſwaſions hereupon ambaſſadours imparted theſe word concerning kinga remembrance king word pope nun •• o deſeruing obſeruation god forbid quoth ſhould euer enter heart minde french make warre againſt chriſtian prince without cauſe manifeſt ſubiect ambition cannot moue v iot aſpire make pretence empire becauſe beleeue king france maiſter ligne called royall blood made mount kingly throne noble flower de luce death ſeazing life neereſt heire ſucceede much excellent emperour whatſoeuer commeth dignity voluntarie election ſhall ſuffice lord count robert brother ſo great king ad hoc legati nolit deus vt vnquam aſcendat cor noſtrum vt aliquem chriſtianum ſine manifeſta cauſa impugnemus nec no pulſat ambitio credimus enim dominum noſtrum regem galliae quem linea regij ſanguinis prouexit ad sceptra francorum regend • excellentiorem eſſe aliquo imperatore quem ſola electio prouehit voluntaria ſufficit domino comiti roberto fratrem eſſe tanti regis theſe word monke england mathew • aris concerning peaceful eſtate franceon peaceable eſtate kingdome france dependeth whole proſperity holy seate chriſtendome yeare 1248 king lewes ſetting voyage ouer sea paſſed lyon viſite pope innocent fourth permiſſion retired pius ſecundus formerly named aeneas syluius pregnotarie ſaid councill ego nequaquam timebo nationum ordinem ſeruare c 1 ex natione italica recepti ſunt epiſcopi guillelmus vercellenſis georgius de sable writeth thus veneta vrbe controuerſia inter henrici galliae philippi hiſpaniae regum oratores obort est vterque enim primum honoratiorem locum publicè apud principem senatumque ſibi exhibere poſtulabat diu id patres decernere recuſarunt nihil que antiquâ priorique conſuetudine quod omnium memoria ſemper obſeruatum fuerat à senatu immutatum eſt cenſuit tamen senatus vt gallus orator hiſpanum apud principem publice praecederet natalis à comitibus ſaith franciſcus vargas hiſpanus legatione apud • enetos tunc fungebatur per quod tempus primum nata eſt controuerſia de ſuperiore loco inter hiſpanum gallumque reges ſame author ſaith guſmanus sylua philippi regis orator venetios conceſſerat ordinarius orator futurus apud eum senatum huius aduentu iniecta eſt opinio certa ſocietatis regis hiſpaniarum legatum regis galliae magna contentio dicente hiſpano hoc actu canonizationis ſancti didaci hiſpani ſibi deberi primum locum cum potiſsimum ad regnum hiſpaniae pertineret praeterea ſibi principales quaſdam operationes hoc actu incumbere reſpondit legatus franciae peractis ijs quae facienda hiſpano erant aut sacello exiret aut locum inferiorem occuparet hiſpanus iterum vt ſaltem francus ille hac vice idque ex gratia grace french courteſie primum locum concederet petijt cui francus ſe quidem hunc locum illi conceſſurum hac lege ne quid derogaret iuri praecedendi quod galli habebant quod abſ que praeiudicio primo quod habiturus eſſet pontifex sacello legatus hiſpanicus qui ſe inferiorem francico ſemper oſtendens huc nun • quam accedere ſolet praeſens adeſſet locumque inferiorem ſuo occuparet reſpondet hiſpanus ſe nullo modo id facturum hoc enim facto fateretur ſe illi cedere dum ſic inter ſe contendunt ſubrepit paulatim ira incaluit ſanguis adeò vt ad armae propemodum ad maximum tumultum ventum fuiſſet niſi aliorum auctoritas interpo • ita eſſet tandem negotium hoc modo compoſitum eſt legatus hiſpanicus ad sacellum non •• iret ſed cardinalis deca eius roſtro deferens • ullam coeleſtis doni chriſmate repletam cuius odoris mirabili reſperſi nectare inaeſti • abili qui aderant ſuper omnia quibus ante à delectati fuerant replentur ſuauitate acceptus rheimes abbey archmonaſterie rhemigius rheimes ſendeth greeting wee giue vnderſtand inſtant monday eighteenth day moneth october eight clocke morning appeare hoſtell perſon meſsire thomas de cauchon rheimes day holy sacring crowning king france ſaid holybottle ſo farre high altar church de noſtre dame de rheimes bottle miraculouſly ſent heauen containeth holy oyle sacred vnction wherewith annointed king clouis firſt moſtchriſtian king french ſucceſſiuely doe like moſtchriſtian king france time following end high altar ought ſtand aſſiſtants vntill ſuch time sacring finiſhed high maſſe ſaid celebrated church noſtre dame de rheimes without ſight thereof according ſtand obliged doe haue ſame returning preſence lord abbot saint rhemigius hath honor beare ſeruing aide aſſiſtants conducting ſame ſafetie body rhemigius hath bin immemoriall antiquitie kept preſerued ſame manner haue vſed accompanie ſolemnitie ſaid church noſtre dame du rheimes know ye yeſterday sunday ſeauenteenth day moneth october foreſaid yeare one thouſand ſixe hundred tenne day sacring preſence ſaid lauall exchecquer attorney euery one ſaid baron knight holybottle ſeruiceably came performed duetie carriage thereof ſaid day eight clocke morning church saint rhemigius ſaid baron knight cloathed habit white sattin mantle cloakes blacke taffata left ſide cloakes embrodered croſſe belonging knighthood order holybottle framed pure gold siluer done preſence dom iohn spaniard prieſt doctor ſacred diuinitie high vicare lord abbot saint rhemigius well ſpirituall temporall occaſions graund priour beſide ſaid abbey together religious brotherhood abbey ſaid knight placed rankes preſented themſelues high altar church saint rhemigius proſtrating one knee ground ſigne faith homage kiſſe ſaid holybottle preſented lord graund priour hung necke graund priour allowed kinde acceptation deliuered oath ſuch caſes required faithfull ſeruice laying right hand booke holy euangeliſts true faithfull bringing ſame backe againe ſaid lord graund priour kneeling ranke put croſſe gold enamelled white neck hanging large riband blacke silke croſſe reſembling embrodered cloakes according order kept obſerued antiquitie ought weare life time ſhall enioy ſaid land baronnies neuer without ſaid croſſe neckes theſe gentleman thus come houre appointed morning ſaid church saint rhemigius honorable lord henry gaſton de foix vicount de rabat phillippes de lauall marqueſſe de sablay iacques de brichanteau lord beauuais nangy armand de biron baron chefboutonne foure lord hoſtages pleaſed maieſtie ſend procure bringing holybottle sacring came preſented themſelues lord graund priour v declaring pleaſed maieſtie ſend hoſtages holybottle according cuſtome obſerued antiquitie holding lance hand whereon hung enſigne white taffata armed armes moſtchriſtian king france according order kept church noſtre dame de rheimes alſo church saint rhemigius moreouer ſuite lord graund priour would pleaſed honor preſence notary royall thereto called done lord graund priour deſcended downe ſteps high altar saint rhemigius ſaid holybottle hanging necke graund priour cloathed coope rich cloth gold nethermoſt ſaid ſteps preſented lord hoſtages state conopie pallium cloath siluer ſent maieſtie lord abbot graund vicare vnder carrie ſaid holybottle rhemigius church noſtre dame according cuſtome lord graund priour receiued graciouſly preſented himſelfe three knight holybottle v reaſon knight abſence acquit honorable charge vnder canopie lord graund priour ſtept holybottle hanging necke attired ſaid holybottle went two ſaid lord hoſtages launce hand two behinde till came forth church great portall whereof preſented foure lord graund priour goodly white hacqueney harneſſed white couered footecloath cloath siluer fringed siluer fringe round maieſtie ſent mount vpon eaſier carriage holybottle auncient cuſtome lord priour receiued humanely thanking maieſtie ſo well following maintaining good auncient cuſtomes hacquency led foure groomes belonging maieſtie aſſiſted lord graund priour mount thereon two leading bridle one right ſide left two waited stirrops ſo guiding conducting decenteſt manner hereupon knight hoſtages mounted horſes knight ſupporting canopie state lord hoſtages riding two bearing banner holybottle ſame manner eſquires alſo bearing banner riding venerable religious brother abbey saint rhemigius attired white aulbes croſſe torchlight ſinging proceſſionally two chauntres cloathed coapes bearing staffe siluer houſes streetes adorned hanging rich tapiſtries chiefeſt religious men went captaine lieutenant enſigne diuers inhabitant du cheſne le populeux ſubiects lord abbot according enioyned doe warning ſent lord graund priour armed faſhion drummes beating enſignes diſplayed thus marched canopie ſome ſome behinde attended officer eſcheuinage belonging rhemigius subiects vaſſailes lord abbot ſaid religious order armes ſent enioyned ſafer conduct holybottle vntill ſhould brought back againe rhemigius according auncient cuſtome lord graund priour accompanied formerly hath bin related arriued great portall church noſtre dame de rheimes entred church attended onely religious brotherhood forenamed foure lord baron knight foure lord hoſtages together two notary royall already named ſome officer captaine enſigne companie du cheſne enting ſaid church nostre dame arriued moſt illuſtrious reuerend lord cardinall pontificall habit accompanied peeres france attired ſuch garment vſe weare ſuch great ſolemnities many prelate beſide ſerious receiuing holybottle deliuered lord graund priour hand ſaid lord cardinall de ioyeuſe officient abſence lord rheimes yet notwithſtanding receipt thereof promiſe made lord cardinall ſafe deliuering ſaid holybottle hand lord graund priour againe sacring ſhould accompliſhed thereupon lord cardinall went vnderneth canopie lord priour attended prelate religious brother going ſome others behinde round canopie ſo ſupported lord knight v haue ſaid vnto high altar noſtre dame ſaid lord hoſtages ſtill aſſiſting neuer par • ing eſpeciall charge duetie lord graund priour keeping alſo right hand southſide high altar church noſtre dame sacring compleated laſted ſpace three houres holybottle redeliuered hand lord graund priour preſence lord cardinall de ioyeuſe ſaid lord knight hoſtages others witneſſing ſame iſſuing forth church noſtre dame lord graund priour mounted white hacqueney againe accompanied already hath bin ſaid well foure lord hoſtages alſo baron knight officer came according appointment conduct ſaid holybottle bringing backe againe church saint rhemigius streetes ſtill remaining beautified adorned peo • le praiſing god goodneſſe sacring ſo happily performed • niſhed come backe church saint rhemigius holybottle • laced ſaid saint body antiquitie hath bin accuſtomed • foure lord hoſtages baron knight holybottle requiring • act related wee yeelded thereto foure lord ho • age deliuered hand lord graund priour foure liueries • nd banner remaine church saint rhemigius memoriall per • etuitie maieſtie formerly banner predeceſſours king haue preſerued honorable remembrance alſo lord • arons knight holybottle likewiſe left staues pal • um cloth siluer deliuered hand lord graund priour • icare lord abbot ſerue ornament church saint rhemi • ius exchecquer attorney hereon conſidered granted • f foure lord hoſtages together foure lord knight ſhould • aue act preſentation duetie ſeruice according formerly • xpreſſed rule drawne afterward patent fairely engroſſed • aine liuing teſtimonie worthy performance law reaſon equi • e iuſtly commanded 〈◊〉 witneſſe whereof wee haue hereunto affixed seale belonging holybottle together bailiwicke saint princeps auſtraſiorum re eccleſiarum propter aſsiduitatem bellorum daicis tradidit floardus archdeacon rheimes chronicle france ſaith hic carolus cunctis qui ante ſe fuerant audacior regibus non ſolum ipſum archiepiſcopatum rhemenſem ſed etiam alios regni epiſcopatus laicis hominibus comitibus dedit behold ample hiſtorie diſcourſe recorded ſecond booke hiſtorie rheimes twelfth chapter manner briefe diſcourſe concerning life action charles martell charles martell ſo ſoone force armes become prince rigobert archbiſhoppe rheimes expelled martell ſole maire pallace france ſpoiled expulſed archbiſhopricke rheimes bleſſed rigobert godfather auouched hee held charles font baptiſme gaue ſaid archbiſhopricke one named milo ſimple prieſt followed warres charles borne lawfull marriage woman ſeruile condition reade annales france moſt audacious boldeſt king predeceſſors haue onely thus archbiſhopricke rheimes martell borne lawfull marriage likewiſe biſhoprickes france countes layemen ſo biſhops bereft meanes exerciſing workes charitie hauing whereupon might well liue chaſtiſed iuſt iudgement god euill committed perpetrated againſt holy man rigobert alſo church ieſus chriſt whoſe iuſt diſpleaſure fell vpon head learne hiſtorie true relation eucherius ſometime biſhop orleans whoſe body buried monaſtery treudon holy biſhop day feruent prayer rapt extaſie carried world among wonder ſaw god gaue ſuch permiſſion beheld charles martell tormented eternall flame eucherius meruailing accident ſo ſtrange demanding ſubiect angell conducter receiued anſwerea ſtrange viſion ſeene caſtle ſe •• ed 〈◊〉 enter • uiſeafter seruice twelue men brought entercourſe caſtle foure goodly tower foure corner erected vpon rocke midſt caſtell ſtood great tower forme donion foure windowes whereof placed beautifull lady richly apparelled foure windowes ſtood foure gallant yong boyes ſinging moſt ſweetly preſence ſpeake truely entercourſe ſeemed terreſtriall paradiſe top pinacles tower donion fixed eſcutchions banner france richly painted emblazoned colour alſo deuiſes king charles ſeauenth order starre white carnation 4 fourth seruice conſiſted foules well great ſmall whole seruice ſumptuouſly guilded euery table placed hundred fortie siluer diſhes according seruices seruice brought entercourſe ſhape beaſtthe ſecond entercourſe tiger called tiger cunning art diſgorged fire mouth noſtrils necke rich coller whereat hung armes deuiſes king coſtly curiouſly formed entercourſe carried ſixe men hauing mandillion bonnet made faſhion bearne danced lord lady according manner countrey moued much mirth laughter entercourſe commended aboue reſt regard new dauncing 5 fift seruice pie tart diſhes creame orangeadoes citron confected table likewiſe ſerued hundred fortie siluer diſhes ſaid seruice carried another entercourſe great hillthe third entercourſe great mountaine mountaine borne foure twentie men mountaine ſtood two faire • rteficiall fountaines one flowed abundantly roſewater muskewater yeelding admirable ſmell ouer haule diuers quarter part mountaine iſſued forth yong liuing cony ſundrie kindes ſmall bird hollow place ſaid hill ſtood foure yong laddes damoſell attired like sauages came forth paſſage rocke dauncing good direction excellent moriſco aſſembly thus done count gaſton cauſed giuen herald trompets waited ſounded dinner time two hundred crownes sunne beſide tenne elles veluet king armes order make roabe 6 ſixt seruice red ipocras wafer diuers ſorts came carried entercourſe man mounted horſebackthe fourth entercourſe man horſebacke artificially formed attired crimzon veluet whole conſiſting goldsmith worke midſt ſmall garden therein ſtood poet gathering kindes roſes floures made waxe deliuered lady made high eſteeme ſuch preſents 7 ſeuenth seruice spicery confection made forme lyon swannes hart ſuch like armes deuiſes king carried liuing peacocke goodly great ship peacocke caried necke armes belonging queene francethe apud longobardos ea c • nſuetudo eſt vt filius regis cum pater non prandeat niſi prius à rege gentis exter • arma suſcipiat cuſtome generall germaines french haue noted firſt booke according teſtimonie caeſar tacitus purpoſe obſerued prince great lord made knight ſolemne feaſts king held full open court honour ſitting table knight returne againe knight geoffrey aniou made knight king henry england anno 11 • 7on day pentecoſte ſaid yeare one thouſand one hundred twentie ſeuen king england ſhould giue order knighthood intended sonne law ſaid geoffrey aniou appeared perſon rouen accompanied fiue gentleman baron owne age made knight sonne foulques lord wit iacquelin de mailly robert de • mblenſay ard • uin de sainct mard robert de boloy payen de claire vaux attended fiue twentie eſquires age knight ceremonie ought haue two eſquires leaſt perſon eſpecially bee preſented altar many sericants officer auncient manner cuſtome making knightson euen feaſt knight made bathed waſhed according auncient cuſtome day come king commanded count geoffrey aſſotiates ſhould brought comming forth bathe geoffrey eſquires chambergroomes fine shirt put ouer waſtecoat crimzen silke embrodered gold whereon hee surcoat caſſock fine scarlet ouer embrodered gold breech ſame stuffe stocking silke shooes curiouſly wrought ſmall golden lyon companion likewiſe cloathed fine linnen scarlet departing ſo garderobe come pallace theſe young gentleman brought gallant courſers glittering armes eſpecially angeuin good iennet spaine ſo fleete ſwift pace equalled flight ayrie birdes armed h • bert double mailled made ſuch temper could pierced ſteele launce dart arrowes greaues legges likewiſe maile curiouſly gilded ſo spurres▪ necke hung shield charged lyon gold helmet head enriched many precious stone ſo ſound temper ſtroakes beſt sword could enter brought launce aſhe head whereof fordged poictiers make vp cloſe arming deliuered goodly sword brought forth king henry rich armorie damasked gilded diuers hiſtories engrauen thereon induſtrious cunning maſter maſterengrauers time named galan new knight mounted vp brauely horſebacke without putting foote stirrop solemnitie laſted ſeuen whole day feaſts tourneis maſcaradoes eight day performed nuptials royall daughter new created knight citie man follow word auncient authour illuceſcente die altera balneorum vſus vti tyrocinij suſcipiendi conſuetudo expoſtulat paratus eſt comperto rex à cubicularijs quod andegauenſis qui cum eo venerant aſcendiſſent de lauacro iuſsit eos ad ſe vocari poſt corporis ablutionem aſcendens de balneorum lauacro comitis andegauorum generoſa prole goffredus byſſo retorta ad carnem induitur cyclade auro texta ſuper veſtitur chlamide conchilij muricis ſanguine tincta tegitur caligis holoſericis calciatur pes eius ſ • tularibus ſuperficie leunculos aureos habentibus muniuntur eius vero conſoda • e qui cum eo militiae ſuſcipiendae munus expectabant vniuerſi byſſo purpurâ •• euantur talibus itaque vt praetaxatum est ornamentis decoratus regius gener quaſi flos li • ij candens roſeo ſuperfuſus rubore cum illo ſuo nobili collactaneo comitatu de secreto thalamus proceſsit publicum adducti ſunt equi allata ſunt arma diſtribuuntur ſingulis pro vt opus erat andegauenſi vero adductus eſt miri decoris equus hiſpa • enſis qui tantae vt aiunt velocitatis erat vt multae aues volando eo tardiores eſſent • nduitur loricâ incomparabili quae maculis duplicibus textâ nullius lanceae vel • aculis cuiuſlibet ictibus transforabilis haberetur calciatus eſt caligis ferreis ex • ulis itidem duplicibus compactis calcaribus aureis pes eius astricti ſunt clypeus leonculos aureos imaginarios habens collo eius ſuſpenditur impoſita eſt capiti eius caſſis multo lapide pretioſo relucens quae talis erat temperaturae vt nullius enſis acumine incidi vel falſificari valeret allata eſt ei haſta fraxinea ferrum pictauenſe praetendens ad vltimum allata eſt ei enſis de sarreſta ſur vn haut chemin fit arreſter toute ſa gent auſsi commenca de • enhorter prier de bien faire son heaume eſtoit tout dorè en ſa main tenoit • e eſpec alemagne toute nuë vous promets que ie ne veis oncques ſi bel homme • mme il eſtoit car il apparoiſſoit par deſſus tous le autres depuis le eſpaules king made ſtand vpon highway cauſed people make ſtand • kewiſe beginning exhort encourage entreated performe • eſt behauiour helmet richly guilded hand held sword allemaigne wholly naked proteſt vnto neuer beheld ſo goodly man • appeared tauleneſſe aboue reſt euen ſhoulders le meſme hiſtorien en parlant de ladite iournee soyez certains que celle iournee le roy fit de plus grand faicts armes que iamais iaye veu faire en toutes le batailles ou • fus onques et diſoit apres la bataille que ſi neuſt eſte ſa perſonne nous euſsions eſte tous perdus morts à celle iournee ie croy qua l heure ſa vertu force luy fuſt doublee par la grace de dieu car il ne ſe feignoit point de ſe mettre aux danger peril de la bataille la ou il voyoit ſes gen en detreſſe il ſe venoit frapper parmy pour le ſecourir tant donnoit de coup eſpee de maſſe que le turcs noſoient approcher de luy et compterent vn iour le sire de courtenay meſsire iean de salonay quils auoient veu que six turcs seſtoient addreſſez au roy celuy iour lauoient pris force par le frei • de ſon cheual lemmenoient mais le vertueux prince voyant le danger ou il eſtoit seuertua de tout ſon pouuoir par grand couragefrappa ſur le turcs qui le tenoient en maniere que luy ſeul ſe deliura de leurs main ſame hiſtorian ſpeaking concerning ſame day ſaith beleeue certaine ſame day king performed faireſt action armes euer life time beheld battailes haue ſeene told battaile one meane creadit himſelfe meane king bin perſon wee bin loſt ſlaine day perſwaded euen inſtant houre hie vertue ſtrength became redoubled meerely grace god failed thruſt himſelfe greateſt danger peril battaile hee ſaw men diſtreſſe laid luſtily ſuccour relieue deliuering ſo many valiant ſtroakes sword battleaxe turkes durſt aduenture come neere related ſame day lord de courtnay meſſire iohn de salonay ſaw ſixe turkes addreſſed robertum nepotem ſuum filium • oberti fratris ſui attrebatenſis comitis quondam apud maſſorram interfecti eos cum pluribus alijs milites nouos geniſtellae fecit vbi tanta fuit laetitiae ſolemnitas quod populus ciuitatis pariſienſis ab omni opere vacans ſolummodo laetitiae exultationi intentus per octo dy amplius ciuitate per totum cortinis pannorum varij coloris ornamentis pretioſis mirabiliter enuious againſt valiancie prince ſcourge sarrazins tranſmarinis partibus virum armis ſtrenuum qui viribus ſuis potentia terram sanctam antequam reges illi illuc venirent mira ſtrenuitate regebat rex vero philippus auditis literis ira inflammatus ſtatim ab eodem caſtro receſsit plurimum ſollicitus multis dicbus permanſit et quia animus ipſius regis pro huiuſmodi rumoribus multum turbabatur ſollicitudo magi ac magi creſcebat dy habito cum familiaribus conſilio miſit nuntios ſuos ad vetulum arſacidarum regem vt per ipſum rei veritatem diligentius plenius cognoſceret interim tamen paleſtine yeare grace one thouſand two hundred fortie eight ſet downe firme reſolution doe remainder life two twentie yeares hee cloathed himſelfe meane ſimply reſt court would weare coſtly ſumptuous lord ioinuille life hee made vſe greene red fine murrey violet exquiſite furres ermine letice spur bridle horſes stirrops plaine white watercolour without guilding embrodery ab illo tempore quo • iter tranſmarinum arripuit nunquam indutus eſt squaleto vel panno viridi ſeu bru • eta nec pellibus varijs ſed veſte nigri coloris vel camelini perſei similiter ex tunc nunquam vti voluit calcaribus vel fraenis niſi omnino albis ferreis abſque aliqua aura • ura nec cellis ad equitandum niſi albis ſine omni pictura theſe word william de nangis monke denys france writing life thoſe time king france port sea belonging might take shipping long voyagesthe king england duke guyenne normandie hauens remaine owne power king england duke guyenne normandie vnder hommage france poſſeſſed port ocean sea boione ſo farre piccardie count vermandois held count flanders reſt sea count prouence toloſa languedocke prouence port mediterranean sea ſhorteſt cut paſſage leuant sea vnder ſubiection saint lewes conſtrained firſt voyage borrow count prouence brother port marſeilles whence hee lanched forth armie conſiſted two thirtie thouſand men fiue twentieth day auguſt yeare one thouſand two hundred fortie eight ſhaping courſe cyprus hee arriued moneth september fol • owing william nangis life ſame saint lewes large declareth ſet forth port aiguemortes tandem rex ad portum aquarum mortuarum veniens die marti craſtino beati bartholomaei apoſtoli nauem cum ſuis intrauit paſſage hath failed haue learned towne aiguesmortes port thereof finiſhed till yeare one thouſand two hundred fiftie two yeare death laſt raymond count toloſa ſaid deceaſe yeare one thouſand two hundred fortie nine mathew paris wrote hiſtorie england ſame time dyed ſame lewes obſerueth notably ſaid king diſanchored marſeilles aiguesmortes rex igitur francorum vale dicto papae innocent fourth held generall councill lyon againſt emperour fredericke accepta ab eo remiſsione peccatorum poſt factam cum moroſa deliberatione confeſsionem cum papali benedictione recedens à lugduno verſus marſiliam lora direxit vexilla little lower progredienſque chriſtianiſsimus rex francorum multa maiora apud marſiliam armie bin greatly euery knight offi • order ſubiect soueraigne whereof cannot haue repa • ion iuſtice yet knight officer ſo wronged ſubmit himſelfe ordenance soueraigne partie maketh refuſall • e soueraigne companion without forfeit honour prouided lord himſelfe goe warre perſon otherwiſe make ſame knowen soueraigne order vnder hand seale concerning trauaile ſeruing war vnder forreigne prince14 ſhall ſo happen ſaid knight doe goe vpon ſome voiage ſeruice armes stranger prince firſt aduertiſe soueraigne thereof brother companion order chaunce taken warre battaile ſtands bound performe good loyall behauiour much poſſibly remaineth▪ ſo great grace fauour tendering mine obedience ſeruiceable duetie ſaid order ſo much lyeth doe ſonne soueraigns anſwerewhereto ſhall anſwered soueraigne renowne vertues mostchriſtian king • belongeth rather die faile time therein wee ſweare alſo maintaine euer order holy ghoſt founded inſtituted v without ſuffe • ing ſhrinke fall diminiſh ſo long rem • ineth power quarrell betweene comman • r officer informing v thereof immediately end wee may • dreſſe ſame hinder proceeding receiuing • rder ſhall ſollemnly ſweare obſerue effect theſe thing diligently 51 apparance hee altogether diſtaſt • ion becauſe phoenix king bird wonder • rld ancient tooke knowledge thereof poetsthe generall opinion phoenix hiſtorians naturaliſts • ſt note ouid fifteenth booke metamorphoſis ſaith vna eſt quae reparet ſequeipſa reſeminet ale aſſyrii phoenica vocant nec fruge nec herbis sed thuris lachrymis ſucco viuit amomi haec vbi quinque ſuae compleuit ſaecuia vitae illicis ramis tremulaeque cacumine palmae vnguibus duro nidum ſibi couſtruit ore quo ſimul ac caſias nardi lenis ariſtas quaſſaque cum fuluâ ſubſtrauit cinnama mirhâ se ſuper imponit finitque odoribus aeuum inde ferunt totidem qui viuere debeat annos corpore de patrio paruum phoenica renaſci cum dedit huic aetas vires onerique ferendo eſt ponderibus nidus ramos leuat arboris altae fertque pius cunaſque ſuas patrium sepulchrum perque leues aura hyperionis vrbe potitus ante fore ſacras hyperionis aede reponit one bird euermore doth new ſelfe beget aſſyrians foule phoenix name ſet like bird corne herbes phoenix liueth ſweet iuy • e frankinſence gum amony life fiue hundred yeares well neere ſpent gone holmetree palmetree gladly mounteth tallants beake build himſelfe neſt beſtrewing caſſia yeares againe sire doth age ſtrength obtaine fit loade heauy neſt beareth tree father graue cradlenurſe labour pietie ſo flieth ayre bright h • perions towne fore hyperion temple gate ſets burthen downe poet doe vnderſtand sunne greeke name hyperion hyperiod greeke name sunne • crificed ſwifteſtrunning horſes wee haue heretofore declared termed towne city sunnea towne edge egypt ſame anci • nt geographer vſually called peluſium nilus emptieth ſelfe • iterranean sea hath beene ſince day called damieta • gypt bankes nile anciently called heliopolis ciuitas solis • ore remarkable ſurprizall forealleadged author haue written fift day 〈◊〉 weeke le coeleſte phoenix commenca ſon ouurage parle phoenix terreſtre ornant dvn tel plumage s membres reuiuants que l annuel flambeau de cairan iuſques en fez ne void rien de plus beau il fit briller ſes yeux il luy planta pour creſte vn aſtre flamboyant au ſommet de ſa teſte il couurit ſon col dor deſcarlate ſon do et ſa queue azur puis voulut quatropos luy ſeruiſt de venus quvne mort feconde rendiſt ſon aage égal au long aage du monde car ayant veu gliſſer deſſous vn ciel diuers et cent fois dix estez cent fois dix hyuers de siecles abatu il luy prend vne enuie de laiſſer en depoſt á la flamme ſa vie de mourir pour renaistre dentrer au tombeau pour apres en ſortir cent mille fois plus beau lors perché ſur le bra dvne palme il entaſſe le baume ſur le nard deſſus la caſſe et ſur le poinct du • de leurs branch bastit son vrne ſon berceau ſon sepulcre ſon nid cependant quil attend quvne flammeche eſpriſe lodorant buſcher ſes o ſacrez reduiſe en genitale poudre que ce bois ardans finiſſent non ſa vie ains ſes caduques an leſchanſon phrygien dvne prodigue aiguiere ne verſe ſur le champ riuiere apres riuiere le froidureux trions ne couurent de verglas le bois phoeniciens lautan ne daigne pa paſſer le bord lybique lantre hyperboree retient dans ſes priſons captif le froid boree car adonc la nature encontre tout effort soigneuſe tient la main à ſa viuante mort s funebres apprests ſa naiſſance ſes couch meſmes le clair soleil ſur ſon lict douxflairant iette vn de ſes cheueux qui tout ſoudain seſprend aux rameaux de sabee peu à pen conſume de limmortel phoenix la chair la plume preſquen meſme moment de ce cendreux monceau naiſt vn ver puis vn oeuf puis vn autrè oyſeau aincois le meſme oyſeau qui nay de ſa ſemence deux cent luſtres nouue aux treſpaſſant recommence au milieu du braſier ſa belle ame reprend infiny par ſa fin dans la tombo ſe rend de ſoymeſme ſe fait par vne mort proſpere nourrice nourriſſon hoir fils pere doth phoe • x bring diuers drugges amber ſweete spice laying vpon altar 〈◊〉 firſt day riſing sunne phoenix fluttereth feather ouer • e heate warmth sunne kindleth fiereth amber drug ſo • ice burne therein phoenix burneth himſelfe next morrow • ſhes worme engendered ſecond day hath feather third day recouereth auncient nature ſo returneth wonted place saint ambroſe hexameron ſaith phoenix locis gentleman king houſe seneſhall poictou portoit couppe de huict piece quatre en chef souſtenus de pareil nombre en poincte le premier de orlean • seconde de milan tierce de bourbon le quart de ornatu ſed nunc nil niſi puluis adeſt aſpice quam fragilis viuas tu putre cadauer tempore ſic fies vermibus eſca breui remonſtrances admonition one couched 〈◊〉 french verſes anſwerable thoſe time carued faire large stone vnder • ngrauing thoſe figure vpper part frieze theſe french verſes eu lan milquatre cent huict iean duc de berry treſpuiſſant en toutes vertu bien inſtruit et prince en france floriſſant par humain cours lors cogniſſant quil conuient toute creature ainſi que nature conſent mourir tendre à pourriture fiſt tailler icy la sculpture de trois vifs auſsi de trois morts et de ſes dorniers la facture en paya par iuſtes accord pour monstrer que tout humaine corp tant ayt biens ou grande cite ne peut euiter le diſcords de la mortelle aduerſitie donc pour auoir foelicite ayons de la mort ſouuenir afin qu apres perplexite puiſsions aux ſaincts cieux paruenir french verſes conuerted engliſh line line thyeare one thouſand foure hundred eight iohn duke berry potently liuing enſtructed vertues firme ſtrait prince france right fairely flouriſhing humaine courſe well vnderſtanding euery creature iniunction nature hath giuen conſenting muſt dye yeelde vnto corruption cauſed made monument three aliue many dead three laſt doe ſhape preſent muſt life paiment accompliſhed ſhew v humaine body though ſtorde good townes greateſt potency yet cannot ſhun thoſe diſcords make ſquare waite vpon mortall aduerſitie may enioy felicitie let v remember ſtill muſt dye fraile life perplexitie soules holy heauens flye voide place theſe verſes armes ſaid duke berry • hich seme propoſition haec aſſertio generaliter poſita ſecundum acceptionem huius vocabuli tyrannus eſt error noſtra fide doctrina bonorum morum eſt contra praeceptum dei • occides gloſſa propriâ auctoritate et contra hoc quod dicit dominus noſter mat • viceſimo sexto omnes qui gladium acceperint gloſſa intelligit propriâ auctori • te gladio peribunt item haec aſſertio vergit ſubuerſionem totius reipublicae vniuſcuiuſque regis aut • incipis item dat viam licentiam apperit ad pura alia mala ad fraudes ad violatio▪ item dat viam licentiam apperit ad plura alia mala ad frudes ad violatio • em fidei counſell conſtans ſixteenth generall fa • condemned hereſies renewed bohemia approuing confirming • decree cenſure sorbonne againſt maxime idleheaded • octor iohn petit recorded fifteenth seſſion whereof theſe • ery word decree counſell sacrosancta synodus praecipuâ ſollicitudine volens ad extirpationem errorum haereſeon diuerſis mundi partibus inualeſcentium prouidêre ſicut tenetur ad 〈◊〉 collecta eſt nuper accepit quod nonnulle aſſertiones erroneae fide bonis moribus 〈◊〉 multipliciter ſcandaloſae totiuſque reipublicae ſtatum ordinem ſubuertere molientes • gmatiſatae ſunt inter quas haec aſſertio delata eſt quilibet tyranus poteſt debet licitè meritoriè occidi per quemcumque vaſſa • ſuum vel subditum etiam per clanculares inſidias ſubtiles blanditias vel adu • tiones nonobstante quocumque praeſtito iuramente ſeu confaederatione facta cum eo non • pectatà sententia vel mandato iudicis cuiuſcumque aduerſus hunc errorem ſatagens haec sanctum synodus inſurgere ipſum funditus tol periuria vias dantem reprobat con • mnat declarat inſuper decernit • ffinit quod pertinaciter doctrinam perntoiſiſsi • hanc aſſertentes ſunt haeretici tanquam tale iuxta canonicas sanctiones puni • di acta conſtantiae anno milleſsimo quadringenteſimo decimoquinto pridie nonas • lij ſame engliſh holy sacred counſell willing imploy care diligence extirpate thoſe errours hereſies bud ſhoote vp diuers order eſtate euery com • onwealth haue bin ſtrangely taught publiſhed among propoſitions • euery tyrant may lawfully meritoriouſly kilde murdred maſſacred vaſſaile subiecta diuelliſh maxime manner whatſoeuer bee eſpecially ſecret ambuſhes inſinuations flattery notwithſtanding oath fidelity allegeance made giuen faith promiſe ſworne vnto without awaiting sentence command iudge generall voyce whole councellthe holy councell willingly oppoſing themſelues againſt error wholly plucke vp roote mature conſultation thereof might beſt bee done buſines haue declared decreed defined ſuch doctrine erroneous faith contrary good manner reproued condemned hereticall ſcandalous ſhewing way miſchiefes falſhoods treaſons fraction faith moreouer haue decreed reſolued declared ſuch wilfull obſtinacie purpoſed deliberation doe hold maintaine propoſition heretiques ſo ought bee puniſhed according concluded holy canon done conſtans yeare one thouſand foure hundred fifteene sixteenth day iuly cenſure france duke orleans propoſition maintained beene declared hereticall moreouer vpon conſequence cenſure iudicially religiouſly deliuered vniuerſity sacred faculty diuines paris hee beene areſted court parliament paris yeare one thouſand foure hundred fourteene seauen twentieth day december ſent ſaid councell conſtans publiſhed throughout kingdomes chriſtendome hee guilty high treaſon hauing iuſtly proſecuted ſtrange enemy buy purchaſe men price whatſoeuer saint gregory •• hath well obſerued bee put practice eſtates world prince would make themſelues great good neighbour paſſage moſt remarkable v haue made much proofe thereof within theſe hundred yeares laſt paſt diuers accident eight booke twenty eight chapter hiſtory france hee ſetteth downe figureth life thoſe miſchiefes haue happened v wiſigothes practice againſt king gonthran saint gontran king france perceiuing league practiſes carried king vuiſigothes spaine neighbour corrupted subiects euen ſo farre owne cabinet reſolued make warre vpon de cauſis commotus gunthramnus rex exercitum hiſpanias deſtinat dum aute • hic exercitus moueretur indiculum à neſcio quibusdam hominibus ruſticis eſt repert • quod gunthramno regi legendum theſe two laſt duke conquered eſtate force owne army fauour ſuccour receiued emperor fredericke conſequent acknowledged duetie wicked life galea deaththis galea maria addicted himſelfe lubricitie whoredomes taking force violence daughter wiues subiects appeaſe inordinate luſt incontinencie whereby ſuch contempt hatred vpon stephen day chriſtmaſſe anno one thouſand foure hundred threeſcore ſeauenteene murdred church stephen meanes iohn andrea lampugnano three complices euen middeſt kinred friend people face iſſue galea maria left bonna sauoye wife two sonnes one daughter named blanch aſcanio meanes baniſhed state millaine two yonger bretheren put death plot deuiſes ſuch preuented could make head againſt calabrian admitted gouerning eſtate diſpoſing financesthe folly great • adies calabrian put tunne hauing dragde moſt infamouſly city streetsthe calabrian beheaded pauia lockt vp priſoner caſtell pauia within ſhort ſmote head theſino eſcaped ſecretly made wiſe fellowes example going siege chaſtelnaud randon geuaudan hee dyed came ſalute good duke bourbon gaue goodly drinking cuppe gold enammeled armes wherein duke entreated hee would drinke dayly ſake hee gaue alſo faire golden girdle rich order deſperance put necke conſtable moſt humbly thanked receiued ioyfully chronicle telleth v siege vertueill place held bee impregnable conſidering ſeating thereof built vpon moſt high rocke made free ſcaling brauely defended troope engliſhmen laſt retreate prouince poictois duke bourbon become maiſter thereof vnneaſtle engliſh thence driuen vndermine within mine duke himſelfe formoſt armes againſt squire caſtle hee heard bee called aloud regnauld de montferrand meeting handyblowes sword fiue ſtroakes one another ſome among hearing blowes could containe themſelues cryed bourbon bourbon noſtre dame whereat squire regnauld de montferrand became much amazeda souldier one eye mine withdrawing himſelfe backward ſaid gentleman lord duke bourbon heere yes truely anſwered borgne de veauſſe hee himſelfe perſon hereupon replyed regnauld de montferrand ſaying bound praiſe god hath day afforded mee ſo great grace honour meete heere armes prince ſo valiant borgne de veauſſe tell deſire hee would ſo well pleaſed honourable place hee would make mee knight owne hand neuer haue giuen mee honorably valour honour haue found ready yeeld place heereon borgne conferred duke bourbon well perceiuing theſe matter tended great honour made anſwer hee well contented doe prouided montferrand ſhould bring keyes dore mine whereto montferrand condiſcended gaue regnould de montferrand made knight duke bourbon mine vnder ground keyes deliuered euen duke himſelfe made knight montferrand requeſted departure would pleaſed giue priſoners skirmiſh dyed marueill wherewith duke bourbon well pleaſed appointed monferrand ſhould ſurrender vp caſtle next morning moreour appointed knight squire duke bourbon ſhould morrow performe action armes mine caſtle one againſt another siluer hee alſo gaue meſſire regnault de montferrand returned moſt hearty thankes accounting himſelfe highly honoured ſaid hee would neuer arme himſelfe ſerue place againſt duke bourbon returne siege ſaid iohn king arragon king lewes eleauenth couenants contract paſſed ſubſtantially betweene two king pateat vniuerſis quod no ioannes dei gratiâ rex aragonum nauarrae scicilia valentiae maioricarum sardiniae corſicae come barcinonae duce athenarum neopatria ac etiam come ruſcinionis ceretaniae attendentes confiderantes vos illuſtriſsimum chriſtianiſsimum principem ludouicum eadem gratia francarum regem conſanguineum confoederatum tanquam fratrem noſtrum chariſsimum dum ſuperioribus diebus celſitudo veſtra villa saluatierra comitatus benarui no autems loco ſancti pelagit sainct palais capitale de la baſſe nauarre ou eſt laudience royale la monnoie regni noſtri nauarrae adeſſet adeſſemus propter ſincerum affectum beneuolentiam praecipuam quam erga no noſtrum honorem geritis obtuliſſe nobis ſuccurſum contra inobedientes aduerſantes nobis cataloniae principatu hoc videlicet modo quod mitteritis ad no ad eundem cataloniae principatum septingentas lanceas munitas ſagittarijs vel alijs gentibusde tractu cum peditatu competenti artillerijs alijs munationibus iuxta formam modum regni veſtri franciae veſtriſqui proprijs ſumptibus expenſis ſeruitio noſtro manebunt vſque quod ipſi catalani inobedientes deuenerint red • cti fuerint ad noſtram veram obedientiam ſimiliter ſi à vobis dicto sereniſsimo francorum rege habere voluerimus ex dictis gentibus veſtris pro ſeruiendo nobis guerra regnis aragoniae valentiae vel altero corumdem regnorum mittetis nobis quadrigentas lanceas duntaxat munitas modo forma praedictis veſtris pariter ſumptibus expenſis quidquid iuſtum fore cenſentes conſonum rationi vt pro maximis ſumptibus expenſis quos quas pro ſtipendijs dictarum gentium ſerenitatem veſtram agere oportebit condecens per no eadem fiat ſatisfactio emenda idcires tenore preſentis deliberationis ac de noſtra certa ſcientia conuenimus paciſcimur vobiſcum dicto illuſtriſsimo francorum rege atque promittimus no obligamus celfitudini veſtrae performam validam ſtipulationem quod primo caſu quo ad no miſeritis ad dictum cataloniae principatum dictas ſeptingentas lanceas munitas ſagittarijs vel alijs gentibus de tractu cum peditatu competenti artillerijs alijs munitionibus • iuxta formam modum dicti regni veſtri franciae vt eſt dictum noſtro ſeruitio veſtris ſumptibus expenſis manſerint vſque quo dicti catalani inobedientes nobis deuenerint reducti fuerint ad noſtram veram completam obedientiam dabimus trademus vibis aut cui ſeu quibus volueritis loco veſtri realiter defacto ducentos mille scutos aureos veteres monetae regni veſtri praedicti franciae le vieux eſcuts faiſolent soixante quatre au marc le poids de huict onces au marc dalloy vingtquatre carat vn quart de carat de remede vel valorem verum corumdem iſto videlicet modo quod ſoluemus aut ſolui faciemus vobis aut cuicumque ſcu quibuſcumque à vobis legitimam poteſtatem habentibus centum mille scutos intra vnum annum computandum eo tempore quo dicti catalani inobedientes deuenerunt reducti fuerunt ad noſtram veram completam obedientiam alios centum mille ſcutos veteres vel verum valorem eorumdem ſoluemus ſeu ſolui faciemus vobis aut cui volueritis mandabitis nomine veſtro intra tempus alterius anni computandi à fine terminus primae ſolutionis faciendae de dictis prioribus centum mille ſcutis ſicundo autem caſu quo ex dictis septingentis lanceis de quibus ſupra mentio habetur quo ad catalauniae principatum à celſitudine veſtra habere voluerimus quadringentas lance munitas modo forma praelibatis illas cum effectu mittetis vestris proprijs ſumptibus expenſis pro ſeruiendo nobis guerra regnis aragoniae valentiae vel altero eorumdem regnorum ibi quantum opus fuerit permanſerint dabimus trademus vobis aut cui ſeu quibus volueritis mandabitis loco veſtri realiter de facto trecentos mille ſcutos auri veteris monetae dicti veſtri regni franciae hunc videlicet modum quod ſoluemus aut ſolui faciemus vobis aut cuicumque ſeu quibuſcumque à vobis ſufficientem poteſtatem habentibus centum mille ſcutos infra annum vnum computandum à tempore quo dicti catalani inobedientes deuenerint reducti fuerint ad nopram veram completam obedientiam alios centum mille ſcutos vetere vel eorum valorem ſoluemus ſcu ſolui faciemus vobis aut cui volueritis mandabitis nomine veſtro intra tempus alterius anni computandi à ſine terminus primae ſolutionis faciendae de dictis prioribus centum mille ſcutis reliquos autem centum mille ſcutos ad complementum autorum trecentorum mille ſcutorum ſuo caſu ſoluemus▪ ſeu ſol • faciemus vobis aut cui voberitis mandabitis nomine veſtro intra tempus alterius anni computandi à fine ter • ini ſecundae ſolutionis faciendae de alijs centum mille ſcutis promittentes vobis dicto ſereniſsimo francerum regi conſanguineo confoe derato tanquam fratri noſtro chariſſi •• que prothonotario notario infraſcripto tanquam publicae authenticae perſonae quorum modo pro omnibus intereſt aut intereſſe poterit quomodo libet futurum legit ime ſtipulanti noſtra bona fide verbo regio quod eoſdem ducentos mille ſeutos caſu ali • trecentos mille ſ • utos ſuo ſingula ſingulis referendo ſoluemus ſeu ſolui faciemus • dabimus vobis ſeu cui aut quibus volueritis mandabitis nomine vestro iuxta mode • ſeu formam ſuperius mentionatam atque tandiu terminis ſupra deſignatis ſtatutis quibuſuis vlterioribus dilationibus ſubterfugijs ac exceptionibus reſeratis penit • procul pulſis adeo omnia ſingula prout per no ſupra infra promiſſa oblig • ſunt tenendum complendum inuiolabiliter obſeruandum omni cum effectu obligauim • vobis dicto ſereniſsimo francorum regi generaliter omnes redditus introitus iura emolumentae querumlibet regnorum terrarum noſtrarum omniaque bona noſtra mobilia ſtabilia quaecumque vbicumque reperientur haebita habenda et ſpecialiter expreſſe obligamus vobis quoſcumque redditus introitus iura emolumenta quae ne habemus ſi tamen aliquae ſui factae gratiae vel aſsignationes ſuper iuribus redditibus dictorum comitatuum roſsilionis ceretaniae vltra ordinari • quod decedentibus ill • qui ea recipiunt vos dictus illuſtriſsimus francorum rex haheatis recipiatis b • bere debeatis cum omni iuris plenitudine integritate iſ • videlicet modo quod po • quam quantitates praementionatae serenitati veſtrae debitae fuerunt quae dicto ordine non fuerint exſolutae modis formis ſuperius memoratis eadem celſitudo veſtra intro • tus iura emolumenta dictorum comitatuum roſsilionis ceretaniae deductis omnibus modo quo ſupra dictum eſt habeat recipiat per manus magnifici ac dilecti conſili • noſtri carolus de vlmis militis procuratoris regij eiſdem comitatibus roſsilionis ceretaniae vel alt • rius ſucceſſoris ſui officio ſupradicto ita quidem quod huiuſmodi redditus recipiendi n • n computentur ſortem principalem dictorum ducentorum mille aut trecentorum mille ſcutorum ſingula ſingulis referendo et nihilominus ad maiorem vberiorem veſtri tuitionem ſecuritatem conuenimus paciſcimur no obligamus quod faciemus operam dabimus efficacem quod dictus carolus de vlmis idoneam faciet obligationem quod aduenientibus caſibus ſupradictis quibus iura redditus introitus • molumenta dictorum comitatuum roſsilionis ceretaniae vigore huiuſmodi conuenti • ni pacti obligationis ad vos pertine • unt de illis reſpondebit sublimitati veſirae vel cui voluerit mandabit iuxta formam ſuperius mentionatam quod quicumque ſucce • ſuus dicto officio procurateris regij ſuo loco tempore conſimilem obligationem qua • fecerit ſuper carolus de vlmis procurator regius qui nunc eſt dictis comitatibus e • ſſilionis ceretani • e et inſuper cupientes vos eundem sereniſsimum francorum reg • ſuper praemiſſis reddere tutiorum eum hac eadem conuenimus paciſcimur no • bligamus quod illustris ioannes de aragonia filius noſter chariſſimus adminiſtrator perpet • u eccleſiae caeſarauguſtanae nobiles petrus durea frater bernardus vgonis de rupebertino commendator montiſſoni ordinis ſancti ioannis hieroſolymitani petrus de peralta f • rrarius de lannes iuſtitia regni aragonum milites conſiliarij noſtri idoneam fac • ent obligationem quod ſi dictus carolus de vlmis procurator regni aut eius ſucceſſor 〈◊〉 eodem officio deficeret ſolutione reddituum iurium dictorum com • tatuum roſſilia • ceretaniae quandiu quantitas dictorum ducentorum mille ſcutorum ſuo caſu vobis • ſolu • tur ipſi quilibet eorum ſolidum tenebitur tenebuntur quoad ſolutionem • taxat iur • um reddituum dictorum comitatuum roſſilionis ceretaniae quae annis ſingulis deductis omnibus modo praedicto ſoluenda erunt vobis quouſque celſitudini veſtra quantitas dictorum ducentorum mille ſcutorum ſuo caſu trecentorum mille ſcutoru • ſuo vel valoris ipſorum ſoluta fuerit cum effectu no eam pro maiori omnibus ſingulorum ſupra infra ſcriptorum fortificatione corroboratione renunciamus quoad que • mu • iuri canonico ciuili foris conſtitutionibus vſaticis legibus alijs iuribus auxili iuris vel facti qui quae ad iſta nobis prodeſſe aut vobis dicto illuſtriſsimo francorum regi • n cere aut obeſſe poſſent quouiſmodo ratione ſeu cauſa qui quae dici ſcribi agitari valerent etiam fauorem regum principum introductis quorum omnium ſingulerum teſtimonium preſens publicum inſtrumentùm confici iuſſimus per protho •• tarium n • ſtrum n • tarium publicum infraſcriptum quod fuit datum actum palatio archi • piſcopali ciuitatis caeſar▪ auguſtae die vigeſimo tertio menſis madij anno à nat • u • te domini milleſimo quadringenteſimo sexageſimo ſecundo regnique noſtri nauarrae tregeſimo ſeptimo aliorum vero regnorum nostrorum quinto signum ioannis dei gratia regis aragonum nauarrae sciciliae valentiae maioricarum sardini • corſicae comitis barcinonae dücis athenarum neopatriae ac etiam comitis roſsilionis ceretaniae praedicta concedimus firmamus huicque publico inſtrumento sigillum noſtrum apponi iuſsimus impendenti teſtes ſunt qui ad praedicta praeſentes fuerunt magnifici martinus de lannes baiulus generalis regni aragonum mile ludouicus de ſancto angelo iuriſperitus fiſci aduocatus conſiliarij ferdinandus de vaquedano secretarius dicti domini regis aragonum signum mei antonij nogueres ſereniſsimi domini regis aragonum prothonotarij ciuſque • horitate per vniuerſam ipſius ditionem publici notarij qui praedictis vna cum praeno • inatis teſtibus interfui eaque per alium ſcribi feci clauſi▪ signatum ſupra plicam b • ra eſt sealed red waxe et no ioannes de aragonia filius praelibati ſereniſsimi domini regis aragonum ac dei apoſtolicae ſedis gratia adminiſtrator perpetuus eccleſiae caeſarauguſtanae petrus du • ea cubernator regni valentiae frater bernardus hugonis de rupebertino preceptor ſiue commendator monteſſoni camerlingi petrus de peralta magiſter hoſpitij ferrerius de lannes iuſtitia regni aragonum praelibati domini regis conſiliarij qui praeſentes fuimus vterque noſtrum ſolidum conuenimus no obligamus vobis sere • iſſimo ac chriſtianiſsimo principi domino domino ludouico dei gratia francorum regi praeſentia prothonotarij ac notarij infra ſcripti tanquam publicae authenticae perſonae recipientis legitime ſtipulantis quod ſi praelibatus carolus de vlmis procurator • egni comitatibus roſſilionis ceretaniae aut eius ſucceſſor quicumque eodem officio deficient ſolutione reddituum iurium dictorum comitatuum roſilionis cere • iae quandi • quantitas dictorum ducentorū mille ſcutorum ſuo caſu dictorum trecen •• rum mille ſcutorum ſuo ſingula ſingulis referendo vobis dicto sereniſsimo domino francorum regi debitae fuerit maieſtati veſtrae non ſoluetur iuxta formam obligationis deſuper factam per dictum illuſtriſsimum dominum noſtrum regem aragonum no quilibet noſtrum ex noſtris certis ſcientijs tenebimur tenebitur serenitati veſtrae quo ad ſolutionem dumtaxat iurium reddituum dictorum comitatuum roſsilionis ceretania quae omnia ſingulis deductis oneribus • • ontento dictum regis obligatione ſoluenda erunt maieſtati veſtrae quouſque ſibi quantitas dictorum ducentorum mille scutorum ſu • caſu trecentorum mille ſcutorum ſuo vel valor •• orum ſoluta fuerit cum effectu quemadmodum dicto publico inſtrumento obligationis praedictum dominum noſtrum regem aragonum facto dicitur continetur atque omnia ſingula prout ſupra dictum eſt ad no attinet ſpectat tenendum complendum inuiolabiliter obſeruandum no vterque noſtrum ſimul ſolidum obligamus perſonas omnia bona noſtra vniuſcuiuſcumque noſtrum immobilia habita habenda vbicunque renuntiamus quo ad haec noſtris iudicibus ordinarijs localibus iudicio eorumdem ſubmittimus no vtrumque noſtrum iuriſdictioni coértioni compulſu cuiuſuis iudicis eccleſiaſtici vel secularis coram quo no ſimul vel diuiſim conuenire malueritis nihilominus renunti • mu legi iuriſperitorum quae dicit quod fideiuſſor conueniri non poteſt niſi prius bona principalia diſcutiantur alicuius iuri canonico ciuili foris conſtitutionibus vſaticis legibus alijs iuribus auxilio iuris vel facti qui quò quoad haec quae ad no attinent maieſtati veſtrae nocere aut obeſſe poſſent quoram omnium ſingulorum teſtimonium preſens publicum inſtrumentum confici volumus ad indemnitatem veſtri ſereniſsimi domini regis francorum prothonotarium notarium publicum infra ſcriptum praeſentibus teſtibus ad ea vocatis rogatis dictis martino de lannes baiulo generali regni aragonum milite ludouico de ſancto angelo iuriſperito fiſci aduocato conſiliarijs ferdinando de vaquedano secretario dicti sereniſsimi domini regis aragonum quod actum fuit dicto palatio archiepiſcopali ciuitatis caeſarauguſtae dicto viceſimo tertio die menſis madij anno à natiuitate domini milleſimo quadringenteſimo sexageſimo secundo signum mei antonij noguerij sereniſsimi domini regis aragonum prothonotarij eiuſque auctoritate per vniuerſam ipſius ditionem publici notarij qui praedictis vna cum pranominatis teſtibus interfui eaſque per alium ſcribi feci cluſi signatum ſupra plicam b ita eſt sealed red waxe king lewes eleauenth ſatisfied contented theſe obligation would need haue intire enioyment thing obliged ſo ſaid iohn king arragon ſold gaue quitted tranſported ſaid king lewes eleauenth mbre good king rene blazoned armes like manner father faſhion deſcribed armes herauld king armes order called croiſſant dor de trois puiſſants royaumes ſous tymbre coronné porte en chef en ſes armes le noble roy rene hongrie sicile hieruſalem auſſi ainſi que voir pouuez en ceſt eſcrit icy aniou bar en pieds duchez de grand renom et vn royal eſcu ſur le tout darragon si eſt lexcellent prince cheualereux courtois pour vray roy fils de roy frere oncle de roys il crie montioyeaniou cartel eſt ſon plaiſir pour deuiſe chaufettes porte ardant deſir et par deuotion amoureuſe ſans blaſme le patènoſtres porte pour lamour deſa dame ſame thus engliſhed three great realmes vnder crowned creſt noble king rene beares chiefe beſt hungaria sicilie ieruſalem may behold royall ſtemme aniou bar en pieds duchy renowne aboue great arragons rich crowne theſe honor knightly prince fame brings king king sonne vncle brothering king crie montioyeaniou ſuch flamesfire chafingdiſhes deuiſe ardent deſire owne religion since time name word hath bin taken worſt ſenſe referred ſuch hide themſelues lurkingly woodes forreſts prey vpon rob paſſengers ſo corruption letter • tearmed highwayman theeues robber ceaſſe ſpeake fur • returne againe breton countrey bretaigne hauing bin firſt inhabited gomer fol • owers afterward peopled reſt gaules spayne bretaigne firſt peopled gomer follower allemaigne germa • ie italie greece druides made principall abiding whence afterward diſperſed themſelues neighbouring prouinces although • ſo prince high prieſt preſident gaules hold seate principality dreux finibus carnutum caeſar ſaith commentary yet notwithſtanding chiefeſt colledge thoſe drudes gauliſh bre • aigne whereof diſcouſe euen ſame england ſo ought ſame paſſage ſixt booke caeſars commentary vnderſtood diſciplina druidarum britannia reperta eſt atque inde galliam tranſlata bretaigne armorica england • meant bretaigne armorica thither nobleman gaules ſent ſonnes learne thoſe science whereof druides made profeſſion ſame caeſar reporteth place alleadged england named great bretaigne peopled gauliſh breton gaue name heere may ſee aſſurance noble romaine hiſtorian cornelius tacitus life father law iulius agricola • niuerſum aeſtimanti gallos vicinum ſolum england occupaſſe credibile eſt eorum ſacra deprehendas sermo haud multuum diuerſus depoſcendis periculis eadem auda • ia strabo maketh perticuler deſcription breton gaules paſſage england whether caried religion diſcipline language boldneſſe fight ſeemeth hath borrowed caeſar fift booke ſpeaketh manner britannicae maritima par ab ijs incolitur qui praedae belli inferendi cauſa ex ar • oricis tranſierunt qui omnes fere ii nominibus ciuitatum appellantur quibus orti ex ciuitatibus eo peruenerint bello illato ibi remanſerunt atque agros colere coe • erunt venerable beda engliſhmen nation firſt booke firſt chapter eccleſiaſticall hiſtory england ſpeaketh thus britannia oceani inſula cui quondam albion nomen fuit inter septentrionem occidentem locata eſt primis haec inſula britones ſolum quibus nomen accepit incolas habuit qui de tractu armorica vt • ertur britanniam aduecti auſtrales ſibi partes illius vindicarunt certaine maritime coaſtes england inhabited gauliſh breton townes village called caeſar telleth v name thoſe bretaigne armorica cauſeth ſame caeſar ſpeaking walles tearmeth cantium ſay manner faſhion behauiour differed much gaules qui cantium incolunt non multum differunt conſuetudine gallorum meanes nauigation whereto made aptly prepared people caried iſle albion faſhions manner life language religion learned druides tacitus writeth fourteenth booke annales creedily informed lion authun neuers place prouinces france bin druides namely normandie auſonius bourdelois ſpeaking profeſſours famous renowned time maketh mention one patera nation bayeux normandy sexton temple apollo called belenus tu baiocaſſis ſtirpe druidarum ſatus si fama non fallit fidem yet extracted race moſt noble druides bretaigne armorica sourſe fountaine auncient druides whoſe learning diuine science well language knowne renowned • part habitable world • baptas en se • aine ſecondesauant le nom latin que le romulides euſſent le champ deuandre en poinctes aiguiſe le parler doctesainct de bardes druides en grece en italie en memphe eſtoit priſe latine name romulides euander ſharpened ſuch ſort quod no trademus ei mariam filiam noſtram vxorem quando id poterimus facere de iure ſecundum conſuetudinem eccleſia modo fecimus ea quae facere poſſumus ei de iure de ſecuritate dicti futuri • tagij hoc fecimus ei iurari ſicut praedictum eſt de parte noſtrâ et ipſe iurauit nobis quod ipſe accipiet eam vxorem cum ipſa ad aetatem debitam peruenerit numquam vitâ comite dimittet eam aliquo modo actum domino volente vel 〈◊〉 vel ipſe ea acquiſiuerimus ſaluis omnibus teneamentis de quibus no vel homines noſtrit • nentes eramus eo di • quo diſfiduciauimus ioannem regem angliae pro interceptionib • quas nobis f • ceret de hac vltima guerra de qua no obſedimus botauant talus modo qu • quando recipiet hommagia de andegauia cenomania atque turonia ipſe recipiet hommagia illa ſaluis conuentionibus inter no ipſum factis ita quod ſi arturus reſilierit 〈◊〉 conuentionibus inter no ipſum factis ipſi cum feodis ſuis ad no venient no inn • bunt contra ipſum ſuper autem de dominio pictauiae recipimus eundem arturu • hominem ligium ſi dominus dederit quod no vel ipſe eam quocumque modo acquiſ • rimu barones vero pictauiae qui imperij noſtri ſunt alij quos voluerimus facient nobis hommagium ligium contra omnes qui poſſunt viuere vel mori de terris ſuis de pracepto noſtro facient ei hommagium ligium ſalua fide noſtra si autem chariſsimus fr • • r amicus noſter rex caſtellae terra aliquid iuris clamauerit per iudicium curi • noſtrae definietur ſi ipſos de aſſenſu vtriuſque non poterimus pacificare de normannia vero ſic • rit quod no id quod acquiſiuimus de eo quod dominus nobis concedet 〈◊〉 counte duno • ſudden returne france without licence king returned backe france fortified himſelfe caſtle parthenay 〈◊〉 poictou lady beauieu ſeruing ſtill sentinell theſe contrary courſes • nd ſuſpecting returne aduertiſed king thereof cleare • elfe buſineſſe councell regenteſſe ſent duke orleans made abode citty orleans come ſpeedily yield • elfe duke well informed theſe charitable kinde bretaigne king ſummoned duke bretaigne reſtore subiects made vſe reuolt vpon refuſall dealt noble men countrey hee withdrew moſt part fight againſt owne duke meane hee entred puiſſant army bretaigne concerning cuſtome bretaigne diuiſion bretaigne law cal • ed aſſiſe made feodale succeſſion adiudged aduice state eldeſt • rothers siſters kinde grace remained youngeſt • aw duchy bretaigne diuided betweene child duke • ount deceaſed corrected geoffery england count richmond • irſt husband conſtance ducheſſe bretaigne wife may read • nouell aſſiſe new law aſsiſe bretaigne cvm britannia ſuper terris inter fratres diuidendis detrimentum plurimum temerè ſoleat euenire ego gofridus henrici regis filius dux britaniae come riche • ntis vtilitati noſtrae praeuidere deſiderans petitioni epiſcoporum baronum omnium • ritanniae ſatis faciens communi aſſenſu aſſiſiam feci conceſſi quod baronijs • eodis militum vlterius non fierent diuiſiones sed maior natu integrum obtineret • inatum minoribus ſuis prouiderent iuuarent iuxta poſſeſſionem ea vero quae • unc iuniores poſſidebant terris ſiue denariis tenerent quandiu viuerent haeredes • uidem terras tenentium poſſidebunt illas perpetuum denarios autem habentium haeredes poſt patres non haberent item ſi terra minorum deuenerit balliuiam fra • r maior poſt eum bailliam habebit quod ſi fratrem non habue •• ille amitis bailliam • unc cui decedens cum aſſenſu domini ſui eam commendabit filiabus vero qui • em habebit terram habeat minores maritabit de terra ipſa ad conſilium domini propinquorum generis si etiam terra maioris maritagium aliquod accidere con • igerit quod iuniori placeat illud habebit nec alii maior conferre poteſt dum minor velit • bere quod ſi habere noluerit alibi inuenerit maior frater ei de rebus caballis • dando perquirat pro poſſe ſuo cum conſilio propinquorum amicorumque item ſi • minoriterram dederit de quâ eum recipiat hominem ſine haerede obierit alicui de propinquis ſuis cui voluerit eam dabit ita quod ad principalem dominum non redibit • autem eum non receperit hominem ad maiorem fratrem haereditas reuertet hanc aſſiſiam ego gofridus dux britanniae conſtantia vxor mea omnes britanniae barones iurauimus tenere decernimus vt neceſſarium vt maiores natu minores 〈◊〉 valeant nec amplius terris vel denariis partem habituri ſint hanc aſſi • ſiue inſtitutionem nominatim alano de rohan eius haeredibus per totam terram • conceſſimus per manſuram vt igitur hoc ratum ſtabile maneat appoſitione sigillimei conſtantiae vxoris meae voluimus raborari teſtibus adhibitis n redonenſi petro maclouienſi guichar dollenſi epiſcopis mauritaniae nannouodii red aliis plu • ibus baronibus anno domini milleſimo centeſimo octuageſimo theſe homage thus performed king france duke count knight siedge knight mine vnder ground knight accolade embrace chap xviii beſide theſe order france doe beare perticular title king lieutenant general armiesa power peculier martialiſts captaines knight battaile knight mine vnder ground knight siedge • aid city lieutenant general haue power king granted vertue charge battaile ſuch knight made ſuch forme man • er haue obſerued ſecond booke duchie bourgongne alſo may ſuch preheminence authoritie touching power iudgement soueraigne iuriſdiction court parlement ſitting paris wherein ſaid great dayes haue due courſe moreouer entreated would maintain parlement dole saint laurence county bourgongne au • onne land beyond saone antiquitie haue euer 〈◊〉 soueraigne court exerciſe therein ſame forme manner hath bin accuſtomed 〈◊〉 time paſt make knowne haue hereon conſidered eſpecially great affection deſire ſaid three eſtates haue ſhewne effect liue continue alwayes v • der v power ſeruice obedient thing good true loyall subiects conſidering alſo ſaid duchie forenamed land great exte • dure▪ farre good citie paris whereto haue antiquitie reſorted right soueraigntie whereby subiects dwelling ſaid duchie adiacent country ſhall ouermuch trauailed hindered repairing • ither ſeeke purchaſe ſend procure prouiſions remedy th • laſt helpe power soueraigntie theſe cauſes ſerious conſiderations v mouing thereunto wee haue 〈◊〉 eſpeciall grace full power royall authoritie theſe preſents created inſtituted ordained eſtabliſhed ſaid duchie forenamed adiacent country court iuriſdiction soueraigne henceforward held alwayes called • med ſtiled parlement soueraigne court hauing right power soueraigntie ſaid place ſaid great dayes herewith haue ordained ſaid parlements dole saint laurence ſhall henceforth maintained 〈◊〉 soueraigne according heretofore haue bin antiquitie ſaid parl • ments held according manner declared letter patent fo • merly granted ſaid eſtates cauſes appeale 〈◊〉 whereof court soueraigne iuriſdiction may ought take knowledge 〈◊〉 reſort otherwiſe haue bin moued ſuſcitated betweene subiects inhabitant ſaid countrey duchie countie land adiacent ſhall diſcided determined brought due end according soueraigne court • ingdome without admitting sentence definitiue decree prolongings • ſhall giuen pronounced prouoked appealled reclaimed soueraigne courte kingdome cauſes whatſoeuer exhibite action ſaid iuſtice soueraigne iuriſdiction maintay • ing ſupporting preheminences prerogatiues authority right royall v • nd ſaid court wee haue ordained doe ordaine theſe preſents • enceforward ſhall bee ſaid court preſident two knight twelue councellours accuſtomed manner two aduocates one proctour atturney • high iuſticer one pregnotarie chiefe regiſter eche ſaid parlements • e ordenarie vſhers appointed chiefe office ſhall make vp body well e • peciall member ſaid soueraigne courte ſuch ſuch ſtipends • ther letter patent taxed ordained alſo haue giuen • oe giue power exerciſe ſame courte elſewhere throughout limit • aid countrey duchie county action execution exploites soueraigne iu • iſdiction becauſe defect cleare expreſſion ample declaration countrey li • vnderſtanding reſorte ſaid parlement may mooue occaſion • ereafter day day many loſſes debate controuerſies among subiects well • ur ſaid duchie county countreyes kingdome neighbouring bor • ering ſaid duchie bourgongne wee bourgongne ſaid • ord bourgongne faithfull subiects others haue heretofore carried 〈◊〉 armes enſigne ſaid lord ſay croſſe saint andrew • compelled take enſignes vnder command armie • realme without preſence duke conſtables either 〈◊〉 paye wage otherwiſe c wee come againe armes knight golden fleece 〈◊〉 preſent ſeene chaires quire chappell duke 〈◊〉 dijon right hand entring ſaid quire firſt chaire • ore highly exalted table armes inſtitution order 1 vnder helmet written letter gold deuiſe autre naray 〈◊〉 haue none midſt armes dukethe duke armes emblazonned deſquels le premier • uartier eſt de bourgongne qui eſt de france ſans nombre á la bordure componnee dar • ent de gueulles eſcartele de lancienne bourgongne qui eſt bande dor dazur • e ſix piece à l orle de gu • ulles party de brabant qui eſt de sable au lyon rempant • third quarter party de lancienne bourgongne dargent au lyon rem • ant de gueulles luxembourg fourth moderne bourgongne • boue flanders dor au lyon rempant de sable • de vincennes moneth ianuarie yeare grace one thouſand two hundred eleuen heere may behold tenure ego ferrandus come flandriae et hannoniae notum facio vniuerſis ad quos hae preſentes litterae peruenerint quod ego ſum homo ligius domini mei illuſtriſsimi francorum regis philippi contra omnes homines et foeminas qui poſſunt viuere et mori et iutaui eidem quod ego faciam ei bonum ſeruitium et fidele neque ab eo deficiam quandiu mihi voluerit facere rectum curia sua si autem de bono et fideli ſeruitio ei deficiam volo et concedo quod omnes homines mei tam barones quam milites et omnes commun • et communitates villarum et burgorum terrae meae contra ſint eidem domino meo reg • auxilium et mihi ſint innocumentum ad poſſe ſuum vſque dum ſit domino meo regi emendatum ad gratum ſuum et volo et praecipio quod praedicti tam barones quam miletes et alij hanc domino meo regi iurent et faciant ſecuritatem si autem aliquis eſſet qui nollet hoc iurare omne malum quod poſſem faciam ei nec pacem nec treugam cum illo nunquam haberem niſi per voluntatem et beneplacitum domini mei regis eſſet quod vt non poſſit obl • uione deleri et vt praed • cta perpetuam obtineant firmitatem et ſecuritatem praeſentes litteras sigilli noſtri munimine et teſtimonio corroborari fecemus actum vincennis domini milleſimo ducenteſimo vndecimo • nſe ianuarij die quinta ſame regiſters court ſentence would ſeeme begin low country frō riuer somme comprehending therein county bolongne saint paule make homageable count flanders better attayning therto noate downe vnder yeare nine hundred thirtie one king second ligne leaned towards declination arnoull great counte flanders poſſeſſed himſelfe force armes cittie arras abbeis artois afterwarde townes bolongne sea aire doway teronane place beſide regno franciae vnanimiter conuenerunt aſſenſu publico firmauerunt vt primo die maij poſterum ita ſit de feodalibus tenementes quidquid tenetur de domino ligio vel alio modo ſi contigerit per succeſsionem haeredum vel quoquo alio modo diuiſionem inde fieri quoquomodo fiat omnes qui de illo feudo tenebunt de domino feodi principaliter nullo medio tenebunt ſicut vnus antea tenebat priuſquam diuiſio facta eſſet et quandocumque contigerit pro illo totali feodo ſeruitium domino fieri quis libet corum ſecundum quod de feodo tenebit ſeruitium tenebit exhibere illi domino deſeruire reddere romance merlin ſaid round table since haue alſo ſeene manuſcript booke beautified many figure wherein likewiſe repreſented prophet merlin round table theſe verſes french merlin iadis de ſon art pratique moult bien vſant ſelon lancien aage edifia pur chef doeuure authentique la table ronde en triomphant ouurage et ſe monſtraſt expert ſi ſage en ſon ſcauoir que ſon oeuure hautaine sans vice aucun eſtoit perfaicte pleine dhonneur exquis royale ornature car de beautè eſtoit reſplendiſſante et de ouuriers dicte en iudicature la table ronde en honneur triomphante ii la table eſtoit dvn ouurage myſtique bien prattique dexcellent aduentage par cheualiers en eſtat magnifique la ſit garder preſeruer doutrage qui tous eſto • ent remplis de grand courage bien reclamez en ceſte baſſe plaine en la gardant ſouffrirent maintes peines pour lapprouuer par raiſon droicture sur tout ouurage eſtre la plus plaiſante et demourer ſans quelque forfaicture la table ronde en honneur triomphante iii vn seige eſtoit en ceste table antique bien ordonné doeuure de haut parage que meſdiſans ent iuge fantaſtique plus dangereux que tempeſte ou orage mais tels menteurs pleins de mauuais langage furent confus car la place tant ſaine promiſe eſtoit par la cour souueraine galaad ſur toute creature c verſes thus engliſhed merlin long ſince great art skill well fitted graue auncient age erected shielde whereon figured • age sacred virgin ſo sigebert telleth v beholde leſlaus ſaith 〈◊〉 scottiſh hiſtory page hundred fourty fiue vnder reigne king • cotland eugenius third scribunt arthurum regem per haec tempora scotiam hiberniam iſlandiam finmar • orcades inſulas daniam suetiam liuoniam lituaniam pruſiam pomeraniam • hiam hollandiam zelandiam brabantiam flandriam morinum armoricam bri • niam totam denique galliam vi expugnaſſe incolas gentiumque duce vectigales • ciſſe inde vt graecorum perſarum medorum altorumque reges ab eo victos praeteream lucium romanorum imperatorem ſub iugum miſiſſe multa eam ſententiam inducunt vt putem haec potius anilibus quam analibus numeranda verum vt vt re ſit fuit rex arthurus animo inuicto ſummaque virtute verum geſtarum gloriae inſignis concerning kni • hts rounde tableand ſee alſo ſame authour reporteth knight round table ſaith haue ſeene time hunc arthurum scribunt quatuor ſupra viginti athletas equeſtris ordinis quod rei bellicae gloria praeſtabant inſignibus nobilitaſſe ac rei militaris ſcientia gloriaeque magnitudine pares pari omnes amore complexum fuiſſe cum omnes ſimul accumberent nequis forte ſe primo loco conſtitutum glorioſe praedicaret aut ad infimum locum deturbatum inuide cogitaret menſam rotundam ad corona formam effingendam durauit locum quo omnes accumbere ſolebant rotundam arthuri tabulam noſtrates nomine ardulf regno et patria pulſus ad imperatorem dum adhuc nouiomagi moraretur noyon iſle france picardie whereas ſaid emperour charlemaigne exalted king france venit et patefacto aduentus ſui royall cloak crimoſine veluet thick powdred golden leopard archbiſhop gaue expreſſe charge high name god almighty publiſh openly aloud whether reſolued obſerue keepe intirely thoſe thing whereto ſworne whereto king anſwered helpe god would faithfully keepe whatſoeuer hee promiſed without fraud falſe meaning king went take crowne altar deliuered hand archbiſhop hauing crowned king therewith hundred foureſcore tweluethe briefe hiſtory returning home many miſeries duke auſtria leopold duke auſtria came holy land beare armes chriſtian prince arriuall marſhall campe hauing marked lodging puld downe hurld vpon heape ditch mire duke made complaint richard haue reparation offence payed deriſion whereupon duke ſeeing deſpiſed deſired god doe reaſon would remit iniurie richard done wonderfull deedes holyland aduertiſed brother iohn without land firſt occaſion quarrell ſought poſſeſſe himſelfe kingdome england made reſolue returning home sea queene berengaria nauarre wife ioan sicilie siſter ſo continued ſeauen weekes together ſuffering infinite miſeries laſtly caſt coaſt barbarie whence within ſpace three dayes might haue bin marſeilleis fearing count gilles prouince came hoſte gaue anſwer • one onely priſoner knew yet bin • etained ſpace yeare blondel heard wrought • ch meanes became acquainted caſtell minſtrels doe • ſily win acquaintance ſee king could neither vnderſtād • h • one day ſat directly window caſtell blondel ſingeth french song made lord himſelfe king • chard kept priſoner began ſing song french king richard • blondel ſometime compoſed together great riuer danubie mounting bed ordinary current drowned deuaſted great part thereof tenne thouſand perſons duke managing horſe vpon saint stephen day brake one legges whereinto gangrena falling hee glad haue quite cut diſeaſe extending vp thigh fire thereof ſo embraced body miſerable duke acknowledging fault hee promiſed ſatisfie pope command whereupon biſhops countrey gaue abſolution excommun • richard length ſent hoſtages ſo ſaith mathew paris otho auſtria biſhop friſinghen affirmeth pope excommunicated leopold relateth death another manner falling day horſe brake leg affliction thereof cauſing deteſt vanity world hee became hermite auguſtines order leauing seigneury sonnes leopold fredericke hee died yeare one thouſand one hundred foure score foureteene ſaid king richard laſt yeare empoyſoned quarrell ſhot ſaid caſtle one named peter bazile ſeauenth calends aprill liued twelue day time caſtle yeelded poyſon reaching heart king richard dyed tueſday eighteenth ides aprill hee commanded entrailes bowel carried poictiers heart rouen body fonteurauld reaſons alleadged mathew paris buried foot father mathew relateth ſubiect beſieging caſtle chaluz cabrit becauſe would taxe prince couetouſn • ſſe monke denis france rigordus liued ſame timethe reaſons king richards war alleadged rogoraus monke saint denis enſtructeth v rich treaſury picture emperor charlemaigne lewes debonnaire wiues child son daughter ſeated table made fine gold thus heare ſaith followeth anno domini mcxcix sexta idus aprilis ricardus rex angliae iuxta lemouicam ciuitatem grauiter vulneratus occubuit obſederat enim caſtrum quoddam quod calidum lucium de capreolo lemouicenſes vocant hebdomada paſſionis dominicae occaſi • ne cuiuſdam ſauri à quoddam milite ibidem inuenti quod ex nima ambitione à vicecomite lemouicenſi inſtantiſſime ſibi reddi petebat mile enim qui theſaurum inuenerat ad ipſum vicecomitem confugerat dum vero rex obſidione caſtri moram faceret per ſingulos dy ipſum caſtrum viriliter impugnaret baliſtarius quidam ex improuiſo quarello tranſmiſſo regi angliae lethale vulnus intulit paucis reuolutis diebus viam vniuerſae carnis ingreſſus eſt sepultus vero quieſcit apud fontem ebrardi quadam abbatia monialium iuxta patrem ſuum theſaurus autem praedictus vt ferebatur fuerat imperator quidam de auro puriſſimo cum vxore filijs filiabus ad menſam auream reſidentibus qui poſteris quo tempore fuerant certam dabant memoriam ſaid king richard firſt dying without iſſue haue noted inſtituted heyre succeſſor nephew arthur count bretaigne ſucceeded force armes laſt brother king iohn ſucceeded brother richard crown • rouen firſt iohn withoutland earle mortaigne cauſed himſelfe bee crowned rouen ducall circle normandy come iohannes rotomagum veniens octauis paſchae gladio ducatus normanniae accintus eſt matrice eccleſia per miniſterium walteri rotomagenſis archiepiſcopi vbi archiepiſcopus memoratus ante maius altare capite eius poſuit circulum aureum
