eyewitneſſes laſt great maiſter templers executed paris duchie b • rgongne iaques de la maule laſt great maiſter templers named iaques de la maule whoſe portraiture yet ſeene many place paris hath armes que la croix noir octogone de ſon ordre l orle et porfi dargent maiſter viſitor bare company death named ſome brother daulphine without addition followeth rule learned saint bernard preſcribed ſaid templers military order inſtituted life time long italy spayne place binder better direction place thoſe ſheetes marke • starre regvla pavpervm commilitonvm templi sanctum ciuitate cap qualiter diuinum officium audiant vos quidem proprijs voluptâtibus abrenuntiantes que alij pro animarum ſalute vobiſcum ad terminum cum equis armis summo regi militantes matutinas omne ſeruitiuin intergrum ſecundum canonicam inſtitutionem ac regularium doctorum sanctae ciuitatis conſuctudinem pio ac puro affectu audire vniuerſaliter ſtudeatis idcirco vobis venerabiles fratres maximè debetur quia praeſentis vitae luce deſpecta contemptoqu • veſtrorum corporum cruciatu ſaeuientem mundum pro dei amore vileſcere perenniter promiſiſtis diuino cibo refecti ac ſatiati dominicis praeceptis eruditi firmati poſt myſterij diuini conſummationem nullus paueſcat ad pugnam ſed paratus ſit ad coronam cap ii quod orationes dominica ſi audire nequiuerint dicant caeterum ſi aliquis frater negotio orientalis chriſtianitatis fortè remotus quod ſaepius eueniſſe non dubitamus pro tâli abſentia dei ſeruitium non audierit pro matutinis tredecim orationes dominica ac pro ſingulis horis septem ſed pro veſperis nouem dicere collaudamus ac libera voce vnanimiter affirmamus iſti enim ſalutifero labore ita directi non poſſunt accurrere hora competenti ad diuinum officium ſed ſi fieri poteſt horae conſtitutae non praetereantur ante inſtitutum debitum cap iii quid agendum pro fratribus defunctis qvando vero quilibet fratrum remanentium morti quae nulli parcit impendet quod eſt impoſsibile auferri capellanus ac clericus vobiſcum ad terminum charitatiue summo sacerdoti ſeruientibus creditum officium miſſam ſolemniter pro eius anima chriſto animi puritate iubemus offerre fratres autem ibi ad • tantes orationibus pro fratris defuncti ſalute pernoctantes centum orationes dominica vſque ad diem septimum pro fratre defuncto perſoluant ab illo die quo eis obitus fratris denuntiatus fuerit vſque ad diem praedictum centenarius numerus perfectionis integritatem cum fraterna obſeruatione habeat adhuc nempe diuina ac miſericordiſsima charitate deprecamur atque paſtorali auctoirtate iubemus vt quotidie ſicuti fratri viuis agenti dabatur debetur ita quod eſt neceſſarium ſuſtentationi huius vitae cibo potu tantum cuidam pauperi ad quadrage ſimum diem impendatur omnes enim alias oblationes quas morte fratrū paſchali ſolemnitate caeteriſ que ſolemnitatibus domino pauperum commilitonum chriſti ſpontanea paupertas indiſcrete reddere conſueuerat omnino prohibemus cap iv capellani victum veſtitum tantum habeant alias vero oblationes omnia eleemoſynarum genus quomodo fiant capellanis velaliis ad tempus manentibus vnitati communis capituli reddere peruigili cura praecipimus seruitores itaque eccleſiae victum veſtitum ſecundum auctoritatem tantum habeant nihil amplius habere praeſumant niſi magiſtri ſponte charitatiue dederint cap v de militibus defunctis qui ſuntad terminum svnt namque milites domo dei templique salomonis ad terminum miſericorditer vobiſcum degentes vnde ineffabili miſeratione vos rogamus deprecamur ad vltimum obnixe inbemus vt interim tremenda poteſtas ad vltimum diem aliquem perduxerit diuino amore ac fraternâ pietate septem dy ſuſtentationis pro anima eius quidam pauper habeat cap vi vt nullus frater remanens oblationem faciat decreuimus vt ſuperne dictū eſt quod nullus fratrum remanentium aliam oblationem agere praeſumat ſed diu noctuque mundo corde ſua profeſsione maneat vt sapientiſsimo prophetarum hoc aequipollere valeat calicem ſalutaris accipiam morte mea mortem domini imitabor quia ſicut chriſtus pro animam ſuam poſuit ita ego pro fratribus animam ponere ſum paratus ecce competentem oblationem ecce hoſtiam viuentem deoque placentem cap vii de immoderata ſtatione qvod autem auribus noſtris veriſsimus teſtis inſonuit videlicet immoderata ſtatione ſine menſura ſtando diuinum officium vos audire ita fieri non praecipimus imo vituperamus ſed finito pſalmo venite exultemus domino cum inuitatorio hymno omnes ſedere tam fortes quàm debiles propter ſcandalum euitandum no iubemus vobis vero reſidentibus vnoquoque pſalmo finito recitatione gloria patri de ſedibus veſtris ad altare ſe humiliando ob reuerentiam sanctae trinitatis sic etiam recitatione euangelij ad te deum laudamus per totas laudes donec finito benedicamus domino ſtare adſ • ribimus et eandem regulā matutinis sanctae mariae teneri iubemus cap viii de refectione conuentus vno quidem palatio ſed melius dicitur refectorio communiter vos cibum accipere credimus vbi quando aliquid neceſſarium fuerit pro signorum ignorantia leniter ac priuatim quaerere oportet si omni tempore quae vobis neceſſaria ſunt deſunt quaerenda ſunt cum omni humanitate ſubiectione reuerentiae potius ad menſam cum apoſtolus dicat panem tuum cum ſilentio manduca pſalmiſto vos animare debet dicens poſui ori meo cuſtodiam id eſt apud deliberaui vt non delinquerem id eſt lingua id eſt cuſtodiuios meum ne male loquerer cap ix de lectione prandio coena ſemper ſit ſancta lectio recitata si dominum diligimus ſalutifera eius verba atque praecepta aure intentiſsima deſiderare audire debemus lector autem lectionum vobis indicat silentium cap x de carnis refectione hebdemada namque niſi natalis dy domini vel paſcha vel feſtum sanctae mariae aut omnium sanctorum euenerit vobis ter refectio carnis ſufficiat quoniam aſſueta carnis refectio intelligitur henoroſa corporum corruptio si vero die marti tale ieiunium euenerit vt eſus carnium retrahatur craſtino vobis abundanter impendatur die autem dominico omnibus militibus remanentibus necnon capellanis duo fercula honorem sanctae reſurrectionis impendi bonum idoneum indubitanter videtur alij autem videlicet armigeri clientes vno contenti cum gratiarum actione permaneant cap xi qualiter manducare milites debeant dvos duo manducare generaliter oportet vt ſolerter vnus de altero prouideat ne aſperitas vitae vel furtiua abſtinentia omni prandio intermiſceatur hoc autem iuſtum iudicamus vt vnuſquiſque mile aut frater aequalem aequipollentem vini menſuram pro ſe ſolu • habeat cap xii vt alijs diebus duo aut tria leguminum fercula ſufficiant alijs diebus videlicet secunda quart • feria ne • non sabbatho duo aut tria leguminum aut aliorum ciborum fercula aut vt ita dicam cocta pulmentaria omnibus ſufficere credimus ita teneri iubemus vt forte qui ex vno non poterit edere ex alio reficiatur cap xiii quo cibo sexta feria reficere oportet sexta autem feria cibum quadrageſimalem ob reuerentiam paſsionis omni congregationi remota infirmorum imbecillitate femel ſufficere feſto omnium sanctorum vſque paſcha niſi natalis dy domini vel feſtum sanctae mariae aut apoſtolorum euenerit collaudamus alio vero tempore niſi generale ieiunium euenerit bi reficiatur cap xiv poſt refectionem ſemper gratias referant poſt prandium vero coenam ſemper eccleſia ſi propè eſt vel ſi ita non eſt eodem loco summo procuratori noſtro qui chriſtus eſt gratias vt decet cum humiliato corde referre ſtricte praecipimus famulis aut pauperibu • fragmenta panibus tamen integris reſeruatis diſtribuere fraterna charitate debent iubetur cap xv vt decimus panis ſemper eleemoſy nario detur licet paupertatis praemium quod eſt regnum coelorum pauperibus procul dubio debeatur vobis tamen quod chriſtiana fides de illis indubitanter fatetur decimum totius panis quotidi • eleemoſynario veſtro dare iubemus cap xvi vt collatio ſit arbitrio magiſtri cvm vero sol orientalem regionem deſerit ad hibernam deſcendit audito signo vt eſt eiuſdem regionis conſuetudo omnes ad completas oportet incedere vos ac prius generalem collationem ſumere peroptamus hanc autem collationem diſpoſitione arbitrio magiſtri ponimus vt quando voluerit de aqua quando iubebit miſericorditer ex vino temperato competenter recipiatur verum hoc non ad nimiam ſati • tatem oportet fieri ſed parcius quia vino apoſtatare etiam sapientes videmus cap xvii vt finitis completis silentium teneatur finitis itaque completis ad stratum ire oportet fratribus igitur à completerijs exeuntibus nulla ſit denuo licentia data loqui publico niſi neceſsitate cogente armigero autem ſuo quae dicturus eſt leniter dicat eſt vero forſitan vt talus interuallo vobis de completorijs exeuntibus maximum neceſsitate cogente de militari negotio vel de ſtatu domus v • ſtrae quia dy ad hoc vobis ſufficere non creditur cum quadam fratrum parte magiſtrum vel illum cui domus dominium poſt magiſtrum eſt debitum oporteat loqui hoc autem ita fieri iubemus ideo quia ſcriptum eſt multiloquio non effugies peccatum alibi mors et vita manibus lingua eo colloquio ſcurrilitatem verba otioſa ad riſum mouentia omnino prohibemus vobis ad lectulos euntibus dominicam orationem ſi aliquis quid ſtultum eſt locutus cum humilitate puritatis deuotione dicere iubemus cap xviii vt fatigati ad matutinas non ſurgant fatigatos nempe milites non ita vt vobis eſt manifeſtum ſurgere ad matutinas conlaudamus ſed aſſenſu magiſtri vel illius cui creditum fuerit à magiſtro eos quieſcere tredecim orationes conſtitutas ſic cantare vt men ipſorum voci concordet iuxta illud prophetae pſallite domino ſapienter illud conſpectu angelorum pſallam tibi vos vnanimes collaudamus hoc autem arbitrio magiſtri ſemper conſiſtere debet cap xix vt communitas victus inter fratres ſeruetur legitur diuina pagina diuidebatur ſingulis prout cuique opus erat ideo non dicimus vt ſ • perſonarum acceptio ſed infirmitatum debet eſſe cōſideratio vbi autem qui minus indiget agat deo gratias non contriſtetur qui vero indiget humiliter pro infirmitate non extollatur pro miſericordia ita omnia membra erunt pace hoc autem prohibemus vt null • immoderatam abſtinentiam amplecti liceat ſed communem vitam inſtanter tencant cap xx de qualitate modo veſtimenti veſtimenta autem vnius coloris ſemper eſſe iubemus verbi gratia alba vel nigra vel vt ita dicam burella omnibus autem militibus profeſsis hieme aeſtate ſi fieri poteſt alba veſtimenta concedimus vt qui tenebroſam vitam poſtpoſuerint per limpidam albam ſuo conditori ſe conciliari cognoſcant quid enim albedo niſi caſtitas integra caſtitas mentis ſecuritas corporis ſanitas et niſi mil • vnuſquiſque caſtus perſeuerauerit ad perpetuam requiem venire deum videre non poterit teſtante paule apoſtolo pacem ſectamini cum omnibus caſtimoniam ſine qua nemo videbit dominum sed quia huiuſmodi indumentum arrogantiae ac superſtuitatis aeſtimatione carere debet talia habere omnibus iubemus vt ſolus leniter per ſe veſtire exuere calciare diſcalceare valeat precurator huius miniſterij peruigili cura hoc vitare praeſumat ne nimis longa aut nimis curta ſed menſurata ipſis vtentibus ſecundum vniuſcuiuſque quantitatem ſuis fratribus tribuat accipientes itaque noua vetera ſemper reddant praeſenti reponenda camera vel vbi frater cuius eſt miniſterium decreuerit propter armigeros clientes quandoque pro pauperibus cap xxi quod famulus alba veſtimenta id eſt pallium non hab • ant hoc nempe▪ quoderat domo dei ac ſuorum militum templi ſine diſcretione ac conſilio communis capituli obnixe contradicimus funditus quoſi quoddam vitium peculiare amputare praecipimus habebant enim olim famulus armigeri alba veſtimenta vnde veniebant damna importabilia surrexerunt enim vltramontanis partibus quidam pſeudofratres coniugati alij dicentes ſe eſſe de templo cum ſint de mundo hi nempe tantas contumelias totque damna militari ordini adquiſiuerunt clientes remanentes plurima ſcandala oriri inde ſuperbiendo fecerunt habeant igitur nigra ſed ſi talia non poſſunt inuenire habeant qualia inueniri poſſunt illa prouincia qua degūt aut quod vilius vnius coloris cōparari poteſt videlicet burella cap xxii quod milites remanentes tantum alba habeant nvlli ergo conceſſum eſt candida chlamides deferre aut alba pallium habere niſi nominatis militibus chriſti cap xxiii vt pellibus agnorum vtantur decrevimvs communi conſilio vt nullus frater remanens per hyemem pelles aut pelliciam vel aliquid tale quod ad vſum corperis pertineat etiamque coopertorium niſi agnorum vel arietum habeat chap xxiv vt vetuſta armigeris dentur procvrator vel dator pannorum omni obſeruantiâ veteres ſemper armigeris clientibus ſi vetuſtiores pauperibus fideliter aequalitér que erogare intendat cap xxv cupiens optimum deteriora habeat si aliquis frater remanens ex debito aut ex motu superbiae pulchra vel optimum pallium habere voluerit ex talus praeſumptione procul dubio viliſsima merebitur cap xxvi vt quantitas qualitas veſtimentorum ſeruetur qvantitatem ſecundum corporum magnitudinem largitatèmque veſtimentorum obſeruare oportet dator pannorum ſit hoc curioſus cap xxvii vt dator pannorum primis aequalitatem ſeruet longitudinem vt ſuperius dictum eſt cum aequali menſurâ ne vel suſurronum vel criminatorum oculus aliquid notare praeſumat procurator fraterno intuitu conſideret omnibus ſupradictis dei retributionem humiliter cogitet cap xxviii de ſuperfluitate capillorum omnes fratres remanentes principaliter ita tonſos habere capillos oportet vt regulariter antè retro ordinate conſiderare poſſint et barbâ genis eadem regula indeclinabiliter obſeruetur ne superfluitas aut facetiae vitium denot • tur cap xxix de roſtris laqueis de roſtris laqueis manifeſtum eſt eſſe • entile cum abominabile hoc omnibus agnoſcatur prohibemus contradicimus vt aliquis ea non habeat imo prorſus careat alijs autem ad tempus famulantibus roſtra laquea capillorum ſuperfluitatem veſtium immoderatam longitudinem habere non permittimus ſed omnino contradicimus seruientibus enim summo conditori munditia interius ext • rius valde neceſſaria eſt eo ipſo atteſtante qui ait eſtote mundi quia ego mundus ſum cap xxx de numero equorum armigerorum vnicuique veſtrorum militum tres equos habere licet quia domus dei templique salomonis paupertas eximia non permittit amplius praeſentiarum augere niſi cum magiſtri licentiâ cap xxxi nullus armigerum gratis seruientem feriat solum autem armigerum ſingulis militibus eadem cauſa concedimus sed ſigratis charitatiue ille armiger cuiquam militi ſeruierit non licet eidem eum verberare nec etiam qualibet culpa percutere cap xxxii qualiter ad tempus remanentes recipiantur omnibus militibus ſeruire ieſu chriſto animi puritate eadem domo ad terminum cupientibus equos talus negotio quotidie idoneos arma quidquid eis neceſſarium fuerit emere fideliter iubemus deinde vero ex vtraque parte aequaliter ſeruata bonum vtile appretiari equos iudicauimus habeatur itaque pretium scripto ne tradatur obliuioni et quidquid militi vel equis eius aut armigero neeeſſarium erit adiunctis ferris equorum ſecundum facultatem domus ex eadem domo fraterna charitate impendatur si vero interim equos ſuos hoc ſeruitio aliquo euentu mile amiſerit magiſter facultas domus hoc exigit vt alios administret adueniente autem termino repatriandi medietatem pretij ipſe mile diuino amore concedat alteram vero ex communi fratrum ſi ei placet recipiat cap xxxiii quod nullus iuxta propriam voluntatem incedat conuenit nempe militibus qui nihil ſibi carius chriſto exiſtimant propter ſeruitium ſecundum quod profeſsi ſunt propter gloriam ſummae beatitudinis vel metum gehennae vt obedientiam indeſinentur magiſtro teneant tenenda eſt itaque vt mox diximus vbi aliquid imperatum à magiſtro fuerit vel ab illo cui magiſter mandatum dederit ſine mora acſi diuinitus imperetur vt moram pati neſciant faciendo de talibus enim ipſa veritas dicit ob auditu auris obediuit mihi cap xxxiiii si licet ire per villam ſine iuſſu magiſtri ergo ho tale milites propriam voluntatem relinquentes alios ad terminum ſ • ruientes deprecamur firmiter eis iubemus vt ſine magiſtri licentia vel cui creditum hoc fuerit villam ire non praeſumant praeterquam noctu ad sepulchrum ad stationes quae intra muros sanctae ciuitatis continentur cap xxxv silicet eum ambulare ſolum hi vero ita ambulantes non ſine cuſtode id eſt milite aut fratre remanente nec die nec nocte iter inchoare au • ant exercitu namque poſtquam hoſpitati fuerint nullus mile vel armiger aut famulus per atrium aliorum militum videndi cauſa vel cum aliquo loquendi ſine iuſtu vt dictum eſt ſuperius incedat itaque conſilio obfirmamus vt talus domo ordinata à deo nullus ſecundum propriam voluntatem militet aut quieſcat ſed iuxta magistri imperium totus incumbat vt illam domini ſententiam imitari valeat quae dicit non veni facere voluntatem meam ſed eius qui miſit cap xxxvi vt nullus nominatim quod ei neceſſarium erit quaerat hanc proprie conſuetudinem inter caeteras adſcribere iubemus cum omni conſideratione ob vitium quaerendi teneri praecipimus nullus igitur frater remanens aſsignanter nominatim equm aut equitaturam vel arma querere debet quomodo ergo si vero eius infirmitas aut equorum ſuorum debilitas vel armorum ſuorum grauitas talis eſſe agnoſcitur vt ſic incedere ſit damnum commune veniat coram magiſtro vel cui debitum eſt miniſterium poſt magiſtrum cauſam vera fide pura ei demonſtret inde namque diſpoſitione magiſtri vel poſt eum imperantis vel procuratoris re ſe habeat cap xxxvii de frenis et calcaribus nolumus vt omnino aurum vel argentum quae ſunt diuitiae particulares frenis aut pectoralibus vel calcaribus vnquam appareat nec alicui fratri remanenti emere liceat si vero charitatiue talia vetera inſtrumenta data fuerint aurum vel argentum taliter coloretur ne ſplendidus color vel daecor caeteris arrogantia videatur si noua data fuerit magiſter de talibus quod voluerit faciat cap xxxviii tegmen haſtis clypeis non habeatur tegmen autem clypeis haſtis furelli lanceis non habeantur quia hoc non proficium imo damnum nobis omnibus intelligitur cap xxxix de licentia magiſtri licet magiſtro cuiquam equos vel arma vel quamlibet rem cui libet dare cap xl de mala sacco saculus mala cum firmatura non conc • duntur nec habeant abſque magiſtri licentia vel eius cui poſt eum domus negotia creduntur hoc capitulo praeſenti procuratores per diuerſas prouincias degentes non continentur nec ipſe magiſter intelligitur chp xli de lectione literarum nvllatenus cuiquam fratrum literas parentibus ſuis neque quoquam hominum nec ſibi inuicem accipere vel dare ſine iuſſu magiſtri vel procuratoris▪ poſtquam licentiam frater habuerit praeſentia magiſtri ſi ei placet legantur si vero parentibus ei quidquam dire • tum fuerit non praeſumat ſuſcipere illud niſi prius indicatum fuerit magiſtro hoc autem capitulo magiſter domus procuratores non continentur cap xlii de fabulatione propriarum culparum cvm omne verbum otioſum generare peccatum agnoſcatur quid ipſe iactantes de proprijs culpis ante diſtrictum iudicem dicturi ſunt oſtendit ſane propheta ſi à bonis eloquijs propter taciturnitatem debet interdum taceri quanto magi mali verbis propter poenam peccati debet ceſſari vetamus igitur audacter contradicimus ne aliquis frater remanens fabulationes vel vt melius dicam ſtultitias quas saeculo vel militari negotio tam enormiter egit carnis delectationes miſerrimarum mulierum cum fratre ſuo vel aliquo alio vel de alio commemorare debeat et ſi fortè talia referent • quemlibet audierit obmuteſcere faciat vel quantocius poterit cito pede obedientiae inde • ſcedat fabularum venditori aurem cordis non praebeat cap xliii de quaeſtu acceptione vervmenimvero ſi aliquares ſine quaeſtu cuilibet fratri data gratis fuerit deferat magiſtro vel dapiſero si vero aliter ſuus amicus vel parens niſi ad opus dare voluerit hoc prorſus non recipiat donec à ſuo magiſtro licentiam habeat cui re data fuerit non pigeat illum ſi alteri datur imo pro certo ſciat qu • ſi inde iraſcitur contra deum agit hac autem praedicta regula miniſtratores non continentur quibus ſpecialiter hoc miniſterium debetur conceditur de malâ sacco cap xliv de manducarijs equorum vtilis re eſt cunctis hoc praeceptum à nobis constitutum vt indeclinabiliter amodo teneatur nullus autem frater facere praeſumat manducaria linea vel lanea idcirco principaliter facta nec habeat vlla excepto cofinello cap xlv vt cambiare vel quaerere nullus audeat nvnc aliud reſtat vt nullus praeſumat cambiare ſua frater cum fratre ſine licentia magiſtri aliquid querere niſi frater fratri ſit re parua vilis non magna cap xlvi vt nullus auem cum aue capiat qvod nullus auem cum aue accipere audeat no communiter iudicamus non conuenit enim religioni ſic cum mundanis delectationibus inhaerere ſed domini praecepta libenter audire orationi frequenter incumbere mala ſua cum lachrymis vel gemitu quotidie oratione deo conſiteri cum homini quidem talia operante cum accipitre vel aliâ aue nullus frater remanens hac principali causâ ire praeſumat cap xlvii vt nullus arcu vel baliſta percu • iat cvm omn • religionem ire deceat ſimpliciter ſine riſu humiliter non multa verba ſed rationabilia loqui non voce clamoſa ſpecialiter iniungimus praecipimus omni fratri profeſſo ne boſco cum arcu baliſtâ iaculari audeat nec cum illo qui hoc fecerit ideo p • rgat niſi gratiâ eum cuſtodiendi à perfido gentili nec cum cane ſit auſus clamare vel garrulare nec equm ſuum cupiditate accipiendi feram pungat cap xlviii lt leo ſemper feriatur nam eſt certum quod vobis ſpecialiter creditum eſt debitum pro fratribus veſtris animam ponere atque incredulos qui ſemper virginis filio minitantur de terra delere de leone no hoc dicimus quia ipſe circuit quare • quem deuoret manus eius contra omnes • mniumque manus contra eum cap xlix de omni ſuper vos quaeſita iudicium audite nouimus quidem perſecutores ſanctae eccleſi • innumerabiles eſſe hoc qui c • ntentionem non amant inceſſanter crudeliuſque inquietare feſtinant hoc igitur concilii ſententia ſerena conſideratione pendeat vt ſi aliquis partibus orientalis religionis quocunque alio l • co ſuper vos quaeſierit rem aliquam vobis▪ per fideles veri amatores iudices audire iudicium praecipimus quod iuſtum fuerit indeclinabiliter vobis facere praecipimus cap l vt haec regula omnibus teneatur haec eadem regula omnibus rebus vobis immerito ablatis perhumaniter iubemus vt teneatur cap li quod licet omnibus militibus profeſſis terram homines habere diuina vt credimus prouidentiâ à vobis ſanctis locis ſumpſit initium hoc genus nouum religionis vt videlicet religioni militiam admiſceretis ſic religio per militiam armata procedat hoſtem ſine culpâ feriat iure igitur iudicamus cum milites templi dicamini v • ipſos ob inſigne meritum ſpeciale prebitatis donum terram homines habere agricola • p • ſsidere iuſtè eos regere▪ inſtitutum debitum vobis ſpecialiter debetur impendi cap lii vt male habentibus cura peruigil habeatur male habentibus fratribus ſuper omnia adhibenda eſt cura peruigil quaſi chriſto eis ſeruiatur vt illud euangelium infirmus fui viſitatis memoriter teneatur hi eteni • diligenter ac patienter portandi ſunt quia de talibus ſuperna retrib • tio indubitanter adquiritur cap liii vt infirmis neceſſaria ſemper dentur procuratoribus vero infirmantium omni obſeruantiâ atque peruigili curâ praecipimus vt quaecumque ſustentationi diuerſarum infirmitatum ſunt neceſſaria fideliter ac diligenter iuxta domuum facultatem eis adminiſtrent verbi gratia carnem volatilia caetera donce ſânitati reddantur cap liv vt alter alterum ad iram non prouocet praecauendum nempe non modicum eſt ne aliquis aliquem commouere ad iram praeſumat quia propinquitatis diuina fraternitatis tam pauperes quàm potentes ſumma clementia aequaliter adſtrixit cap lv quomodo fratres coniugati habeantur fratres autem coniugatos hoc modo vobis habere permittimus vt ſi fraternitatis veſtrae beneficium participationem petunt vterque ſuae ſubſtantiae portionem quidquid amplius adquiſierint vnitati communis capituli poſt mortem concedant interim honeſtam vitam exerceant bonum agere fratribus ſtudeant ſed veſte candida chlamyde alba non incedant si vero maritus antè obierit patrem ſuam fratribus relinquat coniux de altera vitae ſuſtamentum habeat excedat hoc enim iniuſtum conſideramus vt cum fratribus deo caſtitatem promittentibus foeminae eiuſmodi vn • eademque domo maneant cap lvi vt amplius sorores non coadunentur maribus sorores quidem amplius periculoſum eſt coadunare quia antiquus hoſtis foemineo conſortio complures expulit à recto tramite paradiſi ita que fratres chariſſimi vt integritatis flos inter vos ſemper appareat hac conſuetudine amodò vti non liceat cap lvii vt fratres templi cum excommunicatis non participent hoc fratres valde cauendum atque timendum eſt ne aliquis ex chriſti militibus homini excommunicato nominatim ac publicè aliquo modo ſe iungere aut re ſuas accipere praeſumat ne anathema maranatha ſimiliter fiat si vero interdictus tantum fuerit cum eo participationem habere rem ſuam charitatiuè accipere non immerito licebit cap lviii qualiter milites seculares recipiantur si quis mile ex maſſâ perditionis vel alter secularis seculo volens renunciare veſtram communionem vitam velit eligere non ei ſtatim aſſentiatur ſed iuxta illud pauli probate ſpiritus ſi ex deo ſunt ſi ei ingreſſus concedatur legatur igitur regula eius praeſentiâ ſi ipſe praeceptis expoſitae regulae diligenter obtemperauerit tunc ſi magiſtro fratribus eius recipere placuerit conuocatis fratribus deſiderium petitionem ſuam cunctis animi puritate patefaciat deinde vero terminus probationis conſideratione prouidentiâ magiſtri ſecundum honeſtatem vita petentis omnino pendeat cap lix vt omnes fratres ad ſecretum conſilium non vocentur non ſemper omnes fratres ad conſilium conuocare iubemus ſed quos idoneos conſilio prouidos magiſter eſſe cognouerit cum autem de maioribus tractare voluerit vt eſt dare communem terram vel de ipſo ordine diſceptare aut fratrem recipere tunc omnem congregationem ſi magiſtro placet conuocare eſt competens auditoque communis capituli conſilio quod melius vtilius magiſter conſiderauerit illud agatur cap lx quod cum ſilentio orare debeant omnes fratres prout animi corporis affectus poſtulauerit ſtando vel ſedendo tamen ſummâ cum reuerentia ſimpliciter non clamoſe vt vnus alium non conturbet communi conſilio iubemus cap lxi vt fidem seruientium accipiant agnouimus nempe complures ex diuerſis prouincijs tam clientes quam armigeros pro animarum ſalute animo feruenti ad terminum cupientes domo noſtrâ mancipari vtile eſt autem vt fidem eorum accipiatis ne forte veternus hoſtis dei ſeruitio aliquid furtiue vel indecentereis intimet vel à bono propoſito repente exterminet cap lxii vt pueri quamdiu ſunt parui non accipiantur inter fratres templi qvamuis regula sanctorum patrum pueros congregatione permittat habere no de talibus non conlaudamus vnquam vos onerare qui verò filium ſuum vel propinquum militari religione perhumaniter dare voluerit vſque ad annos quibus viriliter armata manu poſsit inimicos christi de terra sanctum delere eum enutriat dehinc ſecundum regulam medio fratrum pater vel parentes cum ſtatuant ſuam petitionem cunctis pateſaciant melius eſt enim pueritia non vouere quam poſteaquam vir factus fuerit enormiter retrahere cap lxiii vt sene ſemper venerentur sene autem pia conſideratione ſecundum virium imbecillitatem ſupportare ac diligenter honorare oportet et nullatenus quae corporis ſunt neceſſaria diſtricte teneantur ſalua tamen auctoritate regulae cap lxiiii de fratribus qui per diuerſas prouincias proficiſcuntur fratres vero qui per diuerſas prouincias diriguntur regulam quantum vires expetunt ſeruare cibo potu caeteris ſtudeant irreprehenſibilirer viuant vt ab qui foris ſunt bonum teſtimonium habeant religionis propoſitum nec verbo nec actu polluant ſed maxime omnibus quibus ſe coniunxerint sapientiae bonorum operum condimentum exemplum praebeant apud quem hoſpitari decreuerint fama optimum ſit decoratus ſi fieri potest domus hoſpitis illa nocte ne careat lumine ne tenebroſus hostis occaſionem aliquam quod abſit inferat vbi autem milites non excommunicatos congregare audierint illuc pergere non conſiderantes tam temporalem vtilitatem quam externam animarum illorum ſalutem iubemus illis autem fratribus vl • ra marini partibus ſpe ſubuectionis ita directis hac conuentione eos qui militari ordini perhumaniter ſeſe iungere voluerint recipere collaudamus vt praeſentia epiſcopi illius prouinciae vterque conueniat voluntatem petentis praeſull audiat audita itaque petitione mittat eum prater ad magiſtrum ad fratres qui ſunt templo quod est hieruſalem ſi vita eius eſt honeſta talique conſortio digna miſericorditer ſuſcipiatur ſi magiſtro fratribus bonum videtur si verò interim obierijt pro labore fatigatione quaſi vni ex fratribus totum beneficium fraternitas pauperum commilitonum chriſti ei impendatur cap lxv vt victus aequaliter omnibus diſtribuatur illud quoque congrue rationabiliter ••• tenendum cenſemus vt omnibus fratribus remanentibus victus ſecundum locus facultatem aequaliter diſtribuatur non enim eſt vtilis perſonarum acceptio ſed infirmitatum neceſſaria eſt conſideratio cap lxvi vt milites templi decimas habeant credimus namque relictis affluentibus diuitiis vos ſpontaneae paupertatis eſſe ſubiectos vnde decimas vobis communi vita viuentibus iuſte habere hoc modo demonſtrauimus si epiſcopus eccleſiae cui decima iure debetur vobis charitatiue eam dare voluerit aſſenſu il • • capituli de illis decimis quas tunc eccleſia poſsidere videtur vobis tribuere debet si autem laicus quilibet adhuc illam ex patrimonio ſuo damnabiliter amplectitur ſeipſum hoc valde redarguens vobis eandem reliquerit ad nutum eius qui praeſt tantum ſine conſenſu capituli▪ id agere poteſt cap lxvii de leuibus grauibus culpis si aliquis frater loquendo vel militando vel aliter aliquid leue deliquerit ipſe vltro delictum ſuum ſatisfaciendo magiſtro oſtendat de leuibus ſi conſuetudinem non habeant leuem poenetentiam habeat si vero eo tacente per aliquem alium culpa cognita fuerit maiori euidentiori ſubiaceat diſciplinae emendatiori si autem graue erit delictum retrahatur à familiaritate fratrum nec cum illis ſimul eadem menſa edat ſed ſolus refectionem ſumat diſpenſationi iudicio magiſtri totum incumbat vt ſaluus dit indicij perma • eat cap lxviii qua culpa frater amplius non recipiatur ante omnia prouidendum eſt ne quis frater potens vel impotens fortis aut debilis volens ſe exaltare paullatim ſuperbire ac culpam ſuam defendere indiſciplinatus remaneat ſed ſi emendare voluerit ei diſtrictior correptio accedat quod ſi pij admonitionibus fuſis pro eo rationibus emendare noluerit ſed ſuperbia magi ac magi ſeſe erexerit tunc ſecundum apoſtolum de pio eradicetur grege auferte malum ex vobis neceſſe eſt vt à ſocietate fratrum fidelium ouis moribunda remoueatur caeterum magiſter qui baculum virgam manu tenere debet baculum videlicet quo virium imbecillitates aliorum ſuſtentet virgam qua vitia delinquentium rectitudinis zelo feriat concilio patriarchae spiritali conſideratione id agere ſtudeat ne vt ait beatus maximus aut ſolutior lenitas cohibentiam peccantis aut immoderata ſeueritas à lapſu non reuocet delinquentem cap lxix vt paſchali ſolemnitate vſque ad feſtum omnium sanctorum vnam camiſiam lineam tantum ſumere habeat innterea quod nimium ardorem orientalis regionis miſericorditer conſideramus vt à paſchali feſtiuitate vſque ad omnium sanctorum ſolemnitatem vnicuique vna camiſia linea tantum non ex debito ſed ex ſola gratia detur illi dico qui ea vti voluerit alio autem tempore generaliter omnes camiſeas lane habeat cap lxx quot quales panni lecto ſunt neceſſarij singulorum quidem non aliter per ſingulos lectos dormitorium eſſe niſi maximum cauſa vel neceſſitas euenerit communi conſilio collaudamus loctualia vel lectiſternia moderata diſpenſatione magiſtri vnuſquiſque habeat credimus enim prorſus saccum culcitram coopertorium vnicuique ſufficere qui vero ex vno carebit carpitam habeat omni tempore tegmine lineo id eſt veluſo frui bene licebit veſtiti autem camiſiis femoralibus ſemper dormiant dormientibus autem fratribus iugiter vſque mane nuuquam de ſit lucerna cap lxxi de vitanda murmuratione aemulationes inuidias liuorem murmur suſurrationem detractiones diuina admonitione vitare quaſi quandam peſtem vobis fugere praecipimus studeat igitur vnuſquiſque veſtrum fratres chariſſimi vigilanti animo ne fratrem ſuum clam culpet aut reprehendat ſed illud apoſtoli ſtudioſe ſecum animaduertat ne ſis criminator ne ſuſurro populo cum autem fratrem liquide aliquid peccaſſe cognouerit pacifice fraterna pictate iuncta domini praeceptum inter ſe illum ſolum corripiat et ſi eum non audierit alium fratrem adhibeat quod ſi vtrumque contempſ • rit conuentu publice obiurgetur coram omnibus magnae etenim caecitatis ſunt qui ſe liuore minime cuſtodiunt vnde antiquam hoſtis verſuti nequitiam demerguntur vt omnium mulicrum fugiantur oſcula caput vltimum periculoſum eſſe credimus omni religioni vultum mulierum nimis attendere et ideo nec viduam nec virginem nec matrem nec sororem nec amitam vllamque foeminam aliam aliquis frater occulari praeſumat fugiat erge foeminea oſcula chriſti militia per quae ſolent homines perſaepe periclitari vt p • ra worſhip idolls becauſe haue imployment one theſe two vocation howbeit ſome haue written addict themſelues merchandiſe young squire doe weare belt scarffe croſſing body vnder left armehow deale young squire vntill age foureteene yeares made bramenes infinite ſounding trumpet ſollemnities taking leather belt put scarffe three cotton thread concerning samorinthe samorin bramene race weareth cordon baulde king france emperour vnckle ambaſſadours thirtie men tenne made proofe burning iron plowſhares tenne hot boyling water tenne caſt colde water departed thence without harme offending germaines vn chariot conuert de noir luy dict ainſi dame par voſtre information ſur voſtre querelle ie vois aduanturer vie combatre iacques le gris vous ſcauez ſi cauſe eſt iuſte loyale monſeigneur dict la dame il eſt ainſi vous combatez tout ſeurement car la cauſe eſt bonne ce mot le cheualier baiza la dame la prit par la main puis ſe ſeigna entra au champ la dame demeura dedans le char couuert de noir en grandes oraiſons enuers dieu la vierge marie en priant treshumblement qu à ce iour par leur grace interceſsion elle peuſt auoir victoire ſelon le droict quelle auoit et vous dy quelle eſtoit en grande triſteſſe neſtoit pa aſſeuree de ſa vie car ſi la choſe tournoit à deſconfiture ſur ſon mary il eſtoit ſentenciè que ſans remede leuſt arſe ſon mary pendu et en ſuite de quel ques ligne meſsire iean de carouge combatit ſi vaillamment quil enuoya ſon aduerſaire à terre luy bouta leſpee dedans le corp dont il loceit au champ puis demanda si • auoit bien faict ſon deuoir luy reſpondit qu ouy si fut iacques le gris deliure au bourrea • de paris qui le traina à montfaucon la fut pendu meſsire iean de carouge remercia le roy le seigneur de ce quil luy auoit faict deliurer comptant mille franc lauoit retenu de ſa chambre deux cent liures de penſion par durant ſa vie ſe mit à genoux puis il vint à ſa femme la baiſa puis il allerent à legliſe noſtre dame faire leur offrande puis retournerent thouſand thirtie two one inducement bringing poore people peacewhen fraile hope weakeſt god arme ſtrongeſt great men among made ceſſation armes ceſſation happened euen miracle quite contrarie humaine hope therefore honored name treuga dei truce god confirmed yeare grace one thouſand fortie one abſtaining warre betweene king prince great lord nobleman yeoman pardoning receiued wrong free chearefull heart embraced one another eate dranke conuerſed together ſecuritie neuertheleſſe long continuance becauſe ſame sigebert great chronicle informeth v two count named raymonds toloſſa saint gilles king arragon warred ſtearnely againſt without apparance likelihood agreement ſaid lord appeared poore ſimple man named durand apparition beleeued men thereto affected carpenter trade languedocke call dona nobis pacem newes apparition publiſhed abroad count toloſſa saint gilles people neighbouring country went order proceſſion together pilgrimage noſtre lame du puy vpon day aſcenſion according auncient cuſtome people aſſembled biſhop citie puy tooke ſame william durand relation great chronicle france naked poore carpenter theſe word great chronicle placed midſt congregation tell command giuen lord perceiued bent ſerious attention heare began deliuer meſſage boldly commanded lord ſhould make peace among themſelues began cry ſigh ſhed teares praiſe pittie compaſſion lord louing conſent king phillip auguſtus soueraigne lord among article namely couenanted field battaile duella tàm de marchaio quàm de cainone de marchais de chinon ſunt archiepiſcopi ſi fuerint inter homines ſuos ſolent fieri eſpaulo apud cainonem praeſentia campus ſunt archiepiſcopi poterit eos ducere archiepiſcopus quando voluerit et ſi duellum fuerit inter hominem comitis hominem archiepiſcopi tale duellum fiet apud cainonem nec archiepiſcopus nec come tale duellum extra caſtellariam cainonis faciet fieri vterque autem de proprijs hominibus duellum faciet fieri vbi voluerit verum ſi homo archiepiſcopi conqueſtus fuerit de homine comitis duellum adiudicatum fuerit duellum erit comitis si vero homo comitis conqueſtus fuerit de homine archiepiſcopi duellum fuerit adiudicatum duellum doe denie appellant ſay although cannot proue matter witneſſes otherwiſe yet neuertheleſſe auouch owne body againſt others one auouch himthe gage giuen preſence king encloſed field getnleman honeſt man ought doe preſence iudge soueraigne prince caſt downe gage battaile afterward retaine counſell armes horſe thing neceſſarily belonging gage battaile caſe according nobilitie condition appertaining proteſtations following required proteſtations appellation ordenances ſhall regiſtred downe court france elſewhere iudge bee gage firſt ſay moſt excellent moſt chriſtian prince king soueraigne lord kingdome ſtead soueraigne lord ſaythe appellant ſpeeches king moſt excellent moſtchriſtian prince competent iudge bringing finall end ſuch matter haue bin ſpoken propounded bee mee proteſt maintaine lawfull exoine mine owne body haue gentleman inſtead thereof day auouch caſe preſence elſe mine abſence helpe god lady ſhall perfourme loyall deuoyre perill coſts charge reaſon requireth many wayes pleaſe likewiſe armes horſes ſelfe perſon according ſuch caſe belongeth alſo ordaine defendant may ſpeake contrary vpon perill requeſt iniuries ſpoken againſt appellant may requited ſuch amends puniſhments ought ſuffer ſaid caſehow defendant make anſwere king preſence ſaid appellant honour maieſty reſerued competent iudge hath falſely maliciouſly lyed wicked falſe ſpeake defence himſelfe helpe god lady body auoucher without eſſoyne ſaid iudged gage battayle ready day place king soueraigne competent iudge ſhall bee appointed take vp gageand take vp gage ground afterward make proteſtations manner ſaid alſo requeſt auoucher caſe lawfull excuſe eſſoyne may demaunde haue councell armes horſe thing neceſſary anſwerable gage battayle either according nobility whatſoeuer condition elſe beſide expreſſed word proteſtations defence wee commaund likewiſe recorded regiſtred vnderſtand whether may haue gage amends making according iuſtice ſhall ordaine oath p • rſonall appearance day houre place appointedin caſe ſhall ſweare promiſe ſtand bound appeare day houre place aſſigned well day know gage battayle battayle graunted according information proceſſe muſt ſeene carefully reſpected notable wiſe honeſt men clearkes knight eſquires without bearing fauour either party gage gage ſhall adiudged day place hath bin ſaid paine taken reputed recreant conuicted perſon default ſhall made commaundfor deli • ering pl • dges ſhall bee arreſted ſtayed doe deliuer good ſufficient pledge deparing without leaue licence bee done king behalfe either party doe depart without taking leaue v ordaine party doe depart without leaue licence court gage throwne downe taken vp ſo departing without leaue ordaine ſhall taken proclaimed recreant conuicted villaine becauſe hath bin cuſtome appellant defendant entring field ſhould come ſuch due forme law hath ordainedof appellant defendant entring field •• er ought wee order determine muſt bring armes weapon wherewith intend offend one another owne defence ſhall depart houſes lodging horſeback horſes couered foote clothes garniſhments armes viſer ſight helmet put downe shield neck launce hand sword dagger guirded yea ſuch faſhion manner purpoſe fight combat horſeback foote cauſe armes weapon caried beare viſers helmet exalted open without licence leaue iudge bee ſuch preiudice muſt bee conſtrained combate manner entred field according preſent cuſtome becauſe cuſtome appeareth v ſomewhat iniurious combattants ſaid letter preſent chapter wee quallifie ſamea qualification former ſtrict ordena • ce willing ordaining combattants may depart lodging mounted armed hath bin ſaid viſers helmet lifted vp cauſing bee caried shield launce armes reaſonable fitt combating ſuch caſe moreouer make openly knowne true chriſtians departing lodging ſo leyſurely may beeshewes combattants chriſtians right hand ſhall croſſe themſelues beare crucifixe little banner whereon ſhall bee portrayed lord lady angel saint ſhe saint made choice perticulerly deuoted croſſes banner ſhall part vntill alight within pauillions heere followeth firſt three cry fiue prohibition king armes herauld ought make gage battayle combate vi firſt king armes herauld ought come horſeback gate entrance liſts hee crye comming appellant secondly hee crye time appellant defendant ſhall entred ſhall haue made preſentations iudge thirdly ſhall returned making laſt oath according forme following cry loud exalted voyce oyez oyez oyez seigneur cheualiers eſcuyers toutes manie re de gen ce que noſtre sire le bon roy de france vous commande deffend ſur peine de perdre corp biens que nul ne ſoit arme ne porte eſpee ne dague ne autre harnois quel quil ſoit fi ce ne ſont le gardes du champ ceux qui par le roy auront congie pounoir de ce faire encore le roy noſtre sire vous commande deffend que nul de quelque condition quil ſoit durant la bataille ne ſoit à cheual ce ſur peine aux gentils hommes de perdre le cheual aux seruiteurs de perdre vne oreille et ceux qui conduiront le combateurs deſcenduz quils ſeront à la porte du champ ſeront incontinent tenu • renuoyer leurs cheuaux ſur la peine que dicte eſt encore le roy noſtre sire vous commande enioinct à toute perſonne de quelque condition quelle ſoit quil saſsiſe ſur banc ou par terre à ce que chacun puiſſe voir le party combattre plus à ſon gre ſur peine dauoir le poing coupe encore le roy noſtre sire vous commande deffend que nul ne parle ne face signe ne crache ne crie ne face aucun ſemblant quel quil ſoit ce ſur peine dè perdre corp biens heare heare heare lord knight eſquires manner people lord good king france commandeth prohibiteth vpon paine looſing body good none guard field armedthat man ſhall armed neither weare sword dagger harneſſe armour whatſoeuer guard field ſuch haue leaue granted king may doe moreouer king lord commandeth expreſly forbiddeth man condition ſoeuer time battaile combat ſhall dare horſebacke vpon penaltie gentleman looſing horſes seruingmennone horſebacke field looſing eare ſuch appointed guide conducters combattants ſhall diſmount themſelues come gate field horſes ſent away immediately vpon penaltie declared ſit downe bankes groundmoreouer king lord commandeth enioyneth perſons condition degree ſoeuer ſeate themſelues vpon bank downe ground end euery one may behold party combatting eaſily vpon paine haue hand cut moreouer king lord commandeth forbiddeth man doe ſpeake make ſigneno noyſe ſpeaking ſpie crie making ſemblance whatſoeuer vpon paine looſing body gaods appellant ought come horſebacke field armed withall armes vii becauſe according auncient cuſtomes kingdome france appellant ought preſent himſelfe firſt field houre middayhoures appearing field defendant houre foure clocke noone whoſoeuer ſaileth theſe houres held adiudged recreant conuict except mercie iudge therein extended cuſtomes willed commanded ſtill continued ſtand full force yet notwithſtanding vpon ſome good reaſons v mouing thereunto haue qualified thoſe ordenances giue conſent▪ either ſelfe competent iudge may prolong elſe ſhorten thoſe houres according diſpoſitions timesof delaying ſhortning time combat iudges ſhall ſeeme pleaſing taking party power agree order good honor may done giuing another day houre well battailes beginning time combatting finiſhing battaile bringing one ſame point yet neither excuſe himſelfe complaine vſe proteſtations ſame done competent iudges hauing power authoritie doe enſue requeſts protestation party ſhould make entring field viii conſtable marſhals marſhall attendeth buſineſſe appellant ſhall ſay procure ſaid aduocate likewiſe iudge mounted horſebacke entring field theſe word follow firſt entring field moſthonorable lord lord conſtable lord marſhall field ſuch man lord saint george good knight witneſſe day v aſsigned lord king accompliſhing thereof come hither preſent ſelfe vnto doe deuoire requiring impart deliuer portion field winde sunne elſe needefull conuenable profitable ſuch caſe performed doe duetie helpe god lady lord saint george good knight moreouer muſt proteſt doth require may lawfull fight combat either horſebacke footeh • offer marſhall honor ſhall ſeeme beſt either armed diſarmed weare thoſe ſhall like offend defend pleaſure appoint combatting god vouchſafe leaſure doe requireth aduerſe partie ſhall bring field armes conſtitution manifeſtly knowne truth right cauſe hindered combat time combatting performed beſt endeauour ſo right iuſtice honor hath bin impaired proofe ſuch wicked dealing appearing euidently aduerſarie may puniſhed enemy god traitour murderer according condition caſe whether armes charmed enemy ought ſolemnely ſworne therein alſo require proteſt pleaſure god ſuchfor granting another day firſt failing sunneſetting hath diſcomfited ſlaine enemie purpoſed haue done god thereto bin ſo pleaſing new day may granted becauſe much time day loſt paſſage ceremony entring combat according auncient rite cuſtomes ſpace whole day may thus neceſſarily required whereto conſent freely grant moreouer aduerſarie come within due houre aſſigned lord king aduerſarie may afterward accepted held recreant thither bread wine viandes eate drinke ſpace day ſhall ſuch neede thing elſe conuenient requiſite horſe ſuch caſe proteſtations requeſts well generalla day prouiſion field eſpeciall ought require act knoweſt full well true call god lady lord saint george good worthy knight true witneſſes falſe wicked man thou art theſe oathes thus made ſpeeches ſpoken either kiſſe crucifixe togetherthe prieſts maketh laſt crie three laſt three cry xiv king armes herald ready crie people ſeated ſilence made ſpeake word party likewiſe ready performe dutie command marſhall commeth king armes herauld midſt liſts crieth three ſeuerall timesthe combattants leauing pauillions gentleman doe deuoire word two combattants leaue pauillions chaires stooles comming forth mount vpon horſes ſtand readily prepared staues lance wherewith helpe themſelues councellors walking ſuddenly pauillions beaten downe caſt forth liſts two combattants iſſuing forth pauillions vpon voyce command marſhall throweth downe gloue xv done marſhall muſt middeſt field scaffold carrying gloue hand crieth three ſeuerall time let goe together word caſteth downe gloue mounteth horſebacke left owne pleaſurethe combattants left deuoire councellours party without longer tarrying depart leauing man bottell wine loafe bread napkin doe manner gage battaile ſhould granted conqueror ſhould drag vanquiſhed field xvi command gage battaile good ſhall confiſcate prince vanquiſher ought depart liſts honorably xvii pleaſure vanquiſher ſhall depart honorably horſebacke liſts ſame forme made entrance hindered ſome exoine harme happened bodyrights belonging victor carrying weapon wherewith hath conquered aduerſarie right hand hauing pledge hoſtages freely deliuered concerning quarrell whatſoeuer information come contrary make anſwere marſhall field caſe haue charge direct prayer god maintaine right hath euery good chriſtian may keepe himſelfe falling ſuch perill among peril moſt feared none worſe gage battaile wherein many noble man hath found himſelfe deceiued whether right ſide ouer confident cunning ſleights ſtrength blinded pride anger ouerweeninghow dangerous thing gage battaile ſometime ſhames world giuen refuſing peace pride deſpight requireth battaile caſe true right needeth feare cunning force becauſe lord ieſus chriſt iuſt iudge ſuch common ſaying world whoſe aduiſe yet caſe hard followed concluſion ordenances ſtretched vpon bench fourmeconcerning puniſhing seruants worſt kinde faſt bound hand feete body naked ready torture rigour wand containing bigneſſe man little finger sixeſcore ſtripes good account manuall diſtribution giuen wand vpon bellie throughout salique law title de seruo qui de furto fuerit interpellatus eight paragraph si autem seruus de quolibet crimine inculpatus fuerit dominus serui ipſius praeſens adfuit ab eo qui repetit admoneatur vt seruum ſuum ad iuſta ſupplicia dare non differat qui repetit virga paratas habere debet quae ſimilitudinem minimi digiti groſſitudinem habeant scamnum paratum habere debet vt seruum ipſum tendere poſsit leaſt puniſhment ordained wherewith chaſtiſed seruants ſame title laſt paragraph si ancilla talus crimine inculoatur de quo seruus caſtrari debuerat ccxl denarios qui faciunt ſolidos ſex ſi conuenit dominus reddat aut ducentos quadraginta ictus accipiat better fauour ſhowne better seruantspuniſhment better ſeruants ſmitten head wand fiue ſixe yeares growth ſuch fagot bauins made daily growing wood tearmed salique law amortas gaſcoigne calleth endortes law baiorians gamactas sometimes would belabour ſhoulders ſixeſcore ſtripes ſuch wand cudgell fiftie leaſt accounted friendly rumpebatur dorſum eius quinquaginta gamactis law title de furtis seruorum seruant forth houſe maiſter ſteale value two penny redeeme ſhoulders ſixe ſcore penny elſe endure ſo many ſtripes ſoundly laid called damorte si quis seruus foris caſa quod valet duo denarios farauerit inde conuictus fuerit aut flagellis cxx ictus accipiat aut pro dorſo ſuo cxx puniſhment theft according value denariorum qui faciunt solidos iii culpabilis iudicetur ſteale value fortie penny redeeme teſticles well reſtitution principall whereof made theft alſo two hundred fortie penny penalty elſe caſtrated si vero furauerit quod valet quadraginta denarios aut caſtretur aut ducentos quadraginta denarios qui faciunt solidos sex reddat dominus autem serui qui furtum informeth v ſuch contradicted king command hand ſmitten obſerued right eare vſed cut left becauſe therein certaine veinea ſtrange v • n left ſide man anſwereth genitall part cut away maketh man vncapable engendring power done end ſuch race people ſhould leaue world vile vicious breeding whereof doubt many manner cutting eare formerly puniſhed cutpurſes domeſticke houſetheeues ſmall ſtreete de ladicte comteſſe qui eſt decedee ſans hoirs deſcendants de ſon corp qui nauoit iamais eſte groſſe nauoit eu aucuns enfants il nauroit aucune couleur de retenir poſſeder ledict vicomte qui ledict comte auoit publie ou fait publier que le dict part eſtoit deladite comteſſe combien que faucement il euſt eſte ſuppoſe que iamais ladicte comteſſe neuſt eu enfants lequel part ainſi faucement ſuppoſe ſeroit dedans treis iours apres la mort de ladicte comteſſe par enchantement diſparu du lieu sen ſeroit alle comme il eſtoit venu à tout le moins en eſtoit incognue la maniere du departement de prance par ce moyen auroit de celuy qui ſeroit roy tous le priuileges en ſi grand nombre quils voudroient demander quentre autres gentils hommes il auoit pacte fait remonſtrance ou faict faire auoict regnaud de pons entrer auec luy en ladicte ligue confederation quoy ledit regnauld de pons cognoiſsant le grand preiudice dommage qui en pourroit venir à la coronne royaume de france de ſa part comme bon loyal subiect ne ſe ſeroit voulu conſentir diſoit encore ledict regnaud comme bon loyal pour le ſerment la foy en laquelle il ſeroit tenu vers nous que ledict comte auroit faict dit ou faict faire dire contre ſon propre ſerment le choſes ſuſdictes faucement en trahiſen commettant crime de leze maieſte lequel crime eſt de telle nature que en corp en biens il doit eſtre puny encore quil fuſt decede pourroit eſtre procede à la confiſcation de ſes biens diſant outre que ledict comte auroit faict ou faict faire leſdictes choſes afin quil peuſt acquerir tirer à ſoy telle puiſſance que le crime de ſuppoſition de faux part neſt tel que qui en ſoit conuaineu doiue pour cela eſtre condamne la mort naturelle auſsi que faire conſpiration ou aſſ • mblee fin de demander libertez ou franchiſes telles que ledict r • gnaud declare neſt vn tel crime que punition mortelle sen doiue ſuiure par ce que telles choſes ne ſont contre le prince ne contre la ſeurete de ſon peuple ne contre ſes membres comme ſont le conſeillers royaux diſant ledict comte que lintention la volonte de lappelant prouocquant faiſoit beaucoup à conſiderer par ce quil pouuoit apparoir que ledict regnaud eſtoit meu non par ſans preiudice que ledict comte euſt eu volonte de parler audict regnaud ou autre dauoir tels priuileges ou franchiſes comme dict eſt ce neſt cauſe raiſonnable par laquelle puiſſe prou • quer à gage de combat car combien que ledict comte euſt volonte de requerir leſdicts priuileges franchiſes toutefois il eſtoit en la volonte au plaiſir du roy de le luy • nceder ne vaudroit la volonte de le et que telle volonte que ledict comte nauoit iamais eue ainſi quil affirmoit ne regarde ne touche ca de crime pour lequel il doiue auoir combat meſmes à ce moyen que ledict regnaud iuroit mi en auant que de telle volonte ſe ſeroit aucun mal enſuiuy et outre dict ledict comte que par leſdictes ordonnances il faut que la faict ſoit tel que par teſmoins ne puiſſe eſt • e prouue mais que le faicts ſuch harme could haue followed thereon moreouer count added courſe thoſe ordenances appointed caſe muſt ſuch approued witneſſes fact propounded ſaid regnaud againſt count might verified witneſſes count offered make proofe wife truely great childe daughter regnaud maintained falſely imagined yet would approue daughter bin nouriſhed inſtituted heire caſes ſufficiently proued gage combat ought ceaſe likewiſe ſaid aſſemblies conſpiracies alleadged regnaud againſt count might lawfully iuſtifie themſelues becauſe congregat • ons doe preſuppoſe multitude perſons becauſe regnaud expoſed demand count ſpoken ſame word many perſons whereby though thoſe perſons might ſpeake ſingular witneſſe yet notwithſtanding would ſufficiently approue ſuch congregation conſpiracie witneſſes ſufficiently proued gage combat ought therefore accepted furthermore count auouched could make euidently appeare matter propounded regnaud way touch laid charge onely hatred mallice regnaud prouoked count combat let ſuppoſed counteſſe deceaſed without heires deſcended body yet vicountie touraine could come regnaud becauſe ſixeteene perſons neerer heires counteſſe regnaud could hereunto count added royall ordenances caſe wherewith accuſer charged another man ought haue happened euidently way appeared fact propoſed againſt regnaud concerning conſpiracies imputed thereon followed end effect many reaſons alleadged ſaid regnaud end tended adding withall concerning confederacy conſpiracies good loyall subiect lord reuealed moſt deare lord couſine king phillip receiued many matter beſide count like contrary ſide requeſting vpon defence anſwers made iuſtice might rendred done vnto ſaid court departure thence offred defend himſelfe competently vpon matter propoſed ſaid regnaud againſt gage battaile gaue court againſt regnaud thoſe reaſons defence propounded alleadged alwaies reſerued wherein thing elſe count required haue right done ſaid party diligently heard court vpon caſes named either ſide could ſay propoſe royall ordenances peruſed ouer alleadged count without making mention offence hightreaſon thing duely conſiderately examined whatſoeuer elſe could moued court vpon mature diligent deliberation decree ſaid court ſaid regnaud able propound againſt count thing ſaid demand regnaud againſt count hee might ought make anſwere concerning ſuppoſition falſe birth thing touching ſame onely propounded regnaud againſt count decree ſame court ſaid regnaud caſe concerning falſe ſuppoſition onely ſhould receiue gage combat court caſe onely admitted gage matter propoſed regnaud againſt count concerning crime hightreaſon court ſame decree receiued gage combat gage adiudged notwithſtanding caſes alleadged propounded count witneſſe c giuen paris parliament one twentieth day ianuarie yeare grace one thouſand three hundred twentie eight signed gien decree remarkeable ordenance king phillip le bel mention made fourth caſea caſe proued witneſſes alloweth gage combat wherein gage combat permitted nothing ſpoken concerning suppoſition birth muſt ought proued verified witneſſes hereupon court wonted approued wiſdome would admit gage combat concerning crime high treaſon proiects whereof wrought ſubtile cunning meanes lord pons alone might haue communication conſpiracie count commenge court adiudged gage battaile order following time caſe treaſon periurie breach faith concerning life ſaid geoffery plantagenet theſe word svblimato patre eius fulcone hieroſolymitanum regem conſul gauffredus armorum exercitijs laudis adipiſcendae operam dedit nonnullo tempore elapſo areno montis planicie à britoni • u normannis torneamenti dy aſſignata eſt conueniunt ad normannorum partis ſubſidia dominus come flandrenſis theobaudus come bleſenſis cius frater stephanus mauritaniae dominus hi tres henrici regis anglorum erant nepotes conuenit ipſe conſul cum ſuis corum multitudini numerum accreſcens stabant ex aduerſo britannorum acies armis quidem animis ſtrenuae ſed numero pauciores videns itaque conſul andegauenſis gauffredus brittannica cohortis imparem congreſſum auulſus à multitudine ad paucos ſe contulit ipſis opem laturus ſit congreſſus commiſcentur acies fit multus armorum ſtrepitus ſonant editui turbae multiplicis varia vox intonat dant dextrales diſſonos hinnitus à clypeis aureis sole relucentibus mon ipſe michaeliticus reſplenduit animantur viri ad certamen franguntur haſtae fraxincae emutilantur enſes iam pede pe teritur vmbone repellitur vmbo euacuantur ſellae ſupinantur equites equi deiectis seſſoribus ſuis ruptis habenis hinniendo vagantur partis aduerſae ſingularis terror gauffredus aduerſarios impetit huc atque illuc diſcurrens ſuis ſubuenire ſatagit lanceà multos deijcit enſe ictus ingeminans innumeros • itâ expellit sequuntur britones ſpem victoriae ducem praeuium varia mortium genus aduerſarijs inferentes inſtat • degauenſis leone ferocior inſtat phalanx britannica iam de victoriâ praeſumens normanni ſiquidem immenſo certamine fatigati terga dante fugam arripiunt multitudo à paucis confecta ad caſtra repedare compellitur normanni vero confuſione inopinata deiecti singulare certamen britonibus proponunt tranſmarinis namque partibus torneamenti famâ deducente mile sanſonicus gigantae magnitudinis aduenerat cuius viribus audaciâ confidentes de victoria praeſumebant de caſtris igitur normannorum hom • ille humanitatis excedens metas progrediens ſtans loco eminentiori agminibus britonum improperans prouocat co vt quilibet eorum singulari congreſſu cum ipſo decertaret expalluit vultus audientium fortium robur emarcuit quippe verebantur ſinguli cum tantae enormitatis bellua singulare inire certamen intuens vero gener regis magnanimos à natura viros ad inuſitationis inuitae vocem tanquam etenim ille humanae virtutis modum excedens lanccam quaſi liciatorium habens andegauenſem impetit eius scutum loricam non ſine ſanguinis effuſione perforat stat andegauenſis tanquam equo radicatus among ſpeciall men marke noate count geoffrey de mandeuile eodem tempore exierunt ab vrbe londinenſi barones cum militibus qui de regno franciae nuper adu nerant ad equeſirem ludum quod haſtiludium exceeding allowed common rule containing themſelues firmely saddle keeping stirrops may reade statute tourney statute made royall authority concerning iouſts tourney nemo vt equo firmius haereat maiore molimento co deturbetur extraordinaria inſolita adiumenta circumſpiciat ijſque fretus certamen deſcendat ſed communi modo sellae equeſtris stapedum vſu contentus per omnia ſit dexteritate magi ſua quam arte tutu si quis contra haec fecerit omnium incurràt ordinum odium contemptum armiſque equo cum phaleris ſtratis eius mulctetur ſame ne quis vt e quo haereat facilius inſolita inuſitata auxilia circumſpiciat ſed sella equeſtri communi contentus ſit stapedeſque habeat ex aptatos qui ſecus fecerit equo armiſque multetur let man may ſit ſtedfaſtly horſe diſmounted greater ſtrength ſeeke sword common vulgar ſort ſold ſlaues euer open market reſt left souldiours diſcretion maides wiues paſt loſſe honour sacrum prophana ſimul without exception puberibus trucidatis vmbelle vulgus ſub corona venum datum reliqua praeda victoribus cedebat coward crauens fruſtrated pilladge ſuch ouer deſperate harebrandthe ſame puniſhment bloudletting exerciſed ſuch souldiours raſh deſperately lightheaded skirmiſhes bloud boyling ouerhotly take away wilde behauiour thought fit let bleede becauſe onely expoſe themſelues peril danger without reaſon iudgement likewiſe ouerthrow many beſide sometimes barleybread giuen beſt prouiſion like raſcalitie campefollowing boyes obſerued aulus gellius tenth booke ſecond chapter attickenights elſe commanded campe abide lodge without couertures tent whatſoeuer left iniuries weather cornelius tacitus thirteenth booke annales ſpeaking generall corbulo puniſhing raſh preſumption gouernour syria prohibited captaine vantguard pactius orphitus meddle enemy yet notwithſtanding fought againſt diſaduantage againſt hope expectation ſaith congreſſus cum hoſte funditur et damno eius exterriti qui ſubſidium ferre debuerunt ſu • quiſque caſtro trepida fuga rediere quod grauiter c • rbulo accepit increpitumque pactium praefectos militeſque tendere omnes extra vallum iuſſit inque ea contumelia detenti nec niſi precibus vniuerſi exercitus ex ſoluti ſunt soldiour forſooke campe going enſigne colour puniſhed death without hope mercie pardon tacitus former obſerued paſſagethe penaltie leauing colour campe ſaith quia duritiam coeli militiaeque multi abnuebant deſerebantque remedium ſeueritate quaeſitum eſt nec enim vt alijs exercitibus primum alterumve delictum venia proſequebatur sed qui signa reliquerat statim capite poenas luebat although lay frozen ground yet permitted souldiour abandon leaue campe neither could diſpence himſelfe goe forradging owne pleaſure fetch wood though ready die cold annotatuſque mile qui faſcem lignorum geſtabat ita praeriguiſſe manus vt oneri adhaerentes truncis brachijs deciderent running • field ſafety lifehe ſpeedier ſauing himſelfe warre threw away part armes ground engaged ſold puniſhed death doth ciuile lawyer modeſtinus enforme v vnder title de militari ſteale thing campe armie right hand cut bin inſtrument action firſt time offending way veine openedfor theft campe bleede ſaith frontinus stratagem warre fourth booke marcus cato memoriae prodidit furto comprehenſis inter commilitones dextras eſſe praeciſas aut ſilentus animaduertere voluiſſent principijs sanguinem miſſum theft puniſhed vnder emperoursand afterward vnder romaine emperours ſuch soldiours attainted conuicted theft beaten naked roddes ita vt inter verbera fuſtes expirarent ſaith ciuile lawyer modeſtinus de militari cornestraw whence forme poſſeſſion tearmed infeſtucatio deliuering ruſh fiefe freehold prince soueraigne lord vnder firſt monarch inueſted ſeized seruant ringinueſting ſeizing seruant gift ring put vpon finger roundell whereof marked ſuch armes hee would haue seruant beare oftentimes ſeizement made deliuery ruſh straw whereof romaine deriued practiſe taken gaules according obſeruation aulus wee haue heeretofore obſerued meſsire bertrand du gueſclin count longueville portoit dargent laigle eſploye de sable membre becque de gueules au baſton de meſme brochant ſur le tout done biſhop
